model.servicenow.servicenow__user_enhanc.name: servicenow__user_enhanced
model.servicenow.servicenow__user_enhanc.description: Each record represents a user with their associated groups and roles, in addition to additional user info from the sys_user table.

source_relation.name: source_relation
source_relation.description: Indicates the schema which the field originated. This is especially important when leveraging the union schema feature.

sys_user_group_ids.name: sys_user_group_ids
sys_user_group_ids.description: List of associated user group ids.

sys_user_role_ids.name: sys_user_role_ids
sys_user_role_ids.description: List of associated user roles ids.

sys_user_group_roles.name: sys_user_group_roles
sys_user_group_roles.description: List of associated user group roles.

user_created_at.name: user_created_at
user_created_at.description: Date and time when the user record was initially created.

user_updated_at.name: user_updated_at
user_updated_at.description: Date and time when the user record was last updated.

accumulated_roles.name: accumulated_roles
accumulated_roles.description: Roles accumulated or associated with the system user over time.

first_name.name: first_name
first_name.description: First name of the system user.

last_name.name: last_name
last_name.description: The family name or surname of the user.

sys_user_name.name: sys_user_name
sys_user_name.description: The system username or identifier for the user.

is_active.name: is_active
is_active.description: Flag indicating whether the record is currently active.

company_link.name: company_link
company_link.description: Link to the company associated with the record.

company_value.name: company_value
company_value.description: Value representing the company associated with the record.

company_name.name: company_name
company_name.description: The full name of the record.

cost_center_link.name: cost_center_link
cost_center_link.description: Link to the cost center associated with the record.

cost_center_value.name: cost_center_value
cost_center_value.description: Value representing the cost center associated with the record.

department_link.name: department_link
department_link.description: Link to the department associated with the system user.

department_value.name: department_value
department_value.description: Value representing the department associated with the system user.

email.name: email
email.description: Email address associated with the record.

employee_number.name: employee_number
employee_number.description: Employee number or identifier associated with the system user.

gender.name: gender
gender.description: Gender information associated with the system user.

hashed_user_id.name: hashed_user_id
hashed_user_id.description: Hashed identifier associated with the system user.

last_password.name: last_password
last_password.description: The timestamp or information related to the user's last password update.

ldap_server_link.name: ldap_server_link
ldap_server_link.description: A link to the LDAP (Lightweight Directory Access Protocol) server associated with the user.

ldap_server_value.name: ldap_server_value
ldap_server_value.description: The value or name of the LDAP server associated with the user.

manager_link.name: manager_link
manager_link.description: A link to the user's manager or supervisor in the organizational hierarchy.

manager_value.name: manager_value
manager_value.description: The name or identifier of the user's manager or supervisor.

manager_name.name: manager_name
manager_name.description: The system username or identifier for the user.

mobile_phone.name: mobile_phone
mobile_phone.description: The contact number for the user's mobile phone.

phone.name: phone
phone.description: The contact number belonging to this record.

sys_user_roles.name: sys_user_roles
sys_user_roles.description: The roles assigned to the user in the system or organization.

schedule_link.name: schedule_link
schedule_link.description: Link to the schedule associated with the task.

schedule_value.name: schedule_value
schedule_value.description: Value representing the schedule associated with the task.

source.name: source
source.description: The source or origin of the user's or user group's profile information.

state.name: state
state.description: Current state or status of the record (e.g., in progress, on hold, closed).

sys_class_name.name: sys_class_name
sys_class_name.description: Name of the table in which the record is stored.

sys_domain_link.name: sys_domain_link
sys_domain_link.description: Link to the system domain associated with the record.

sys_domain_path.name: sys_domain_path
sys_domain_path.description: Path of the system domain associated with the record.

sys_domain_value.name: sys_domain_value
sys_domain_value.description: Value representing the system domain associated with the record.

time_format.name: time_format
time_format.description: The preferred time format for the user (e.g., 12-hour or 24-hour).

time_zone.name: time_zone
time_zone.description: The time zone configured for the user.

user_name.name: user_name
user_name.description: The username used by the user to log in to the system.

user_password.name: user_password
user_password.description: The user's current password information or status.

count_distinct_sys_user_group_ids.name: count_distinct_sys_user_group_ids
count_distinct_sys_user_group_ids.description: The number of distinct sys_user_group_ids related to this user.

count_distinct_sys_user_role_ids.name: count_distinct_sys_user_role_ids
count_distinct_sys_user_role_ids.description: The number of distinct sys_user_role_ids related to this user.

count_distinct_sys_user_role_names.name: count_distinct_sys_user_role_names
count_distinct_sys_user_role_names.description: The number of distinct sys_user_role_names related to this user.

count_distinct_included_roles.name: count_distinct_included_roles
count_distinct_included_roles.description: The number of distinct included_roles related to this user.

count_distinct_sys_user_group_roles.name: count_distinct_sys_user_group_roles
count_distinct_sys_user_group_roles.description: The number of distinct sys_user_group_roles related to this user.

model.servicenow.servicenow__user_enhanc.raw_code:
{{ config(enabled=var('servicenow__using_roles', True)) }}

with user_aggregates as (

    select *
    from {{ ref('servicenow__user_aggregated')}}
),

sys_user as (
    
    select *
    from {{ ref('stg_servicenow__sys_user') }}
),

core_company as (
    
    select *
    from {{ ref('stg_servicenow__core_company') }}
),

user_enhanced as (

    select

        user_aggregates.*,
        sys_user.user_created_at,
        sys_user.user_updated_at,
        sys_user.accumulated_roles,
        sys_user.first_name,
        sys_user.last_name,
        sys_user.sys_user_name,
        sys_user.is_active,
        sys_user.company_link,
        sys_user.company_value,
        core_company.company_name,
        sys_user.cost_center_link,
        sys_user.cost_center_value,
        sys_user.department_link,
        sys_user.department_value,
        sys_user.email,
        sys_user.employee_number,
        sys_user.gender,
        sys_user.hashed_user_id,
        sys_user.last_password,
        sys_user.ldap_server_link,
        sys_user.ldap_server_value,
        sys_user.manager_link,
        sys_user.manager_value,
        manager.sys_user_name as manager_name,
        sys_user.mobile_phone,
        sys_user.phone,
        sys_user.sys_user_roles,
        sys_user.schedule_link,
        sys_user.schedule_value,
        sys_user.source,
        sys_user.state,
        sys_user.sys_class_name,
        sys_user.sys_domain_link,
        sys_user.sys_domain_path,
        sys_user.sys_domain_value,
        sys_user.time_format,
        sys_user.time_zone,
        sys_user.user_name,
        sys_user.user_password

    from user_aggregates
    left join sys_user
        on user_aggregates.sys_user_id = sys_user.sys_user_id
        and user_aggregates.source_relation = sys_user.source_relation
    left join core_company 
        on sys_user.company_value = core_company.core_company_id
        and sys_user.source_relation = core_company.source_relation
    left join sys_user manager
        on sys_user.manager_value = manager.sys_user_id
        and sys_user.source_relation = manager.source_relation
)

select *
from user_enhanced

model.servicenow.servicenow__task_enhanc.name: servicenow__task_enhanced
model.servicenow.servicenow__task_enhanc.description: Each record represents a task with additional information about its associated problem, incident, or change request. Finally, it contains user information for who opened, started, updated, reported, fixed, closed, requested, reported, or confirmed the task.

source_relation.name: source_relation
source_relation.description: Indicates the schema which the field originated. This is especially important when leveraging the union schema feature.

is_task_active.name: is_task_active
is_task_active.description: Flag indicating whether the task is currently active or completed.

activity_due.name: activity_due
activity_due.description: The due date or time for completing the activity associated with the task.

additional_assignee_list.name: additional_assignee_list
additional_assignee_list.description: List of additional users or assignees associated with the task.

approval.name: approval
approval.description: Information related to the approval status and process for the task.

approval_history.name: approval_history
approval_history.description: History of approvals associated with the task.

approval_set.name: approval_set
approval_set.description: Set of approvals linked to the task.

assigned_to_link.name: assigned_to_link
assigned_to_link.description: Link to the user or group assigned to the task.

assigned_to_value.name: assigned_to_value
assigned_to_value.description: Value representing the user or group assigned to the task.

assignment_group_link.name: assignment_group_link
assignment_group_link.description: Link to the assignment group associated with the task.

assignment_group_value.name: assignment_group_value
assignment_group_value.description: Value representing the assignment group associated with the task.

business_duration.name: business_duration
business_duration.description: The duration of the task in terms of business time. Represented as an epoch timestamp, or the number of seconds from midnight, January 1, 1970.

business_duration_sec.name: business_duration_sec
business_duration_sec.description: The duration of the task in terms of business time (in seconds).

business_service_link.name: business_service_link
business_service_link.description: Link to the business service associated with the task.

business_service_value.name: business_service_value
business_service_value.description: Value representing the business service associated with the task.

calendar_duration.name: calendar_duration
calendar_duration.description: The duration of the task in terms of calendar time. Represented as an epoch timestamp, or the number of seconds from midnight, January 1, 1970.

calendar_duration_sec.name: calendar_duration_sec
calendar_duration_sec.description: The duration of the task in terms of calendar time (in seconds).

close_notes.name: close_notes
close_notes.description: Additional notes or comments recorded upon task closure.

task_closed_at.name: task_closed_at
task_closed_at.description: Date and time when the task was closed or completed.

task_minutes_open_to_close.name: task_minutes_open_to_close
task_minutes_open_to_close.description: The number of minutes from time that the task was opened to the time that the task was closed.

closed_by_link.name: closed_by_link
closed_by_link.description: Link to the user who closed or completed the task.

closed_by_value.name: closed_by_value
closed_by_value.description: Value representing the user who closed or completed the task.

comments.name: comments
comments.description: General comments or notes related to the record.

comments_and_work_notes.name: comments_and_work_notes
comments_and_work_notes.description: Combined information of comments and work notes recorded during the record's lifecycle.

company_link.name: company_link
company_link.description: Link to the company associated with the record.

company_value.name: company_value
company_value.description: Value representing the company associated with the record.

company_name.name: company_name
company_name.description: The full name of the record.

contact_type.name: contact_type
contact_type.description: Type of contact associated with the record (e.g., customer, vendor).

task_description.name: task_description
task_description.description: Detailed description or information about the task.

task_due_date_at.name: task_due_date_at
task_due_date_at.description: The date by which the task is expected to be completed.

expected_start.name: expected_start
expected_start.description: The expected start date or time for the task.

task_follow_up_at.name: task_follow_up_at
task_follow_up_at.description: Timestamp of when follow up was applied to the task.

group_list.name: group_list
group_list.description: List of groups associated with the task.

impact.name: impact
impact.description: Assessment of the impact that completing or not completing the task may have. This is the business loss and potential damage (for example, financial, customer, regulation, security, reputation, brand) caused by the incident

knowledge.name: knowledge
knowledge.description: Indication of whether the task is associated with knowledge or documentation.

is_made_sla.name: is_made_sla
is_made_sla.description: Indicates whether the task was completed within the agreed-upon Service Level Agreement (SLA).

task_number.name: task_number
task_number.description: Unique identifier or reference number assigned to the task.

task_opened_at.name: task_opened_at
task_opened_at.description: Date and time when the task was initially opened.

opened_by_link.name: opened_by_link
opened_by_link.description: Link to the user who initially opened the task.

opened_by_value.name: opened_by_value
opened_by_value.description: Value representing the user who initially opened the task.

task_order.name: task_order
task_order.description: Order or sequence number associated with the task.

parent_link.name: parent_link
parent_link.description: Link to the parent task or record associated with the task.

parent_value.name: parent_value
parent_value.description: Value representing the parent task or record associated with the task.

priority.name: priority
priority.description: Priority level assigned to the task. The priority field is automatically calculated based on the values of impact and urgency. This determines the sequence in which the record should be resolved.

reassignment_count.name: reassignment_count
reassignment_count.description: Count of how many times the task has been reassigned.

route_reason.name: route_reason
route_reason.description: Reason or criteria for routing the task to a particular user or group.

short_description.name: short_description
short_description.description: Brief or concise summary of the record.

sla_due.name: sla_due
sla_due.description: Date and time by which the record is expected to meet the Service Level Agreement (SLA).

task_state.name: task_state
task_state.description: Current state or status of the task (e.g., in progress, on hold, closed).

sys_class_name.name: sys_class_name
sys_class_name.description: Name of the table in which the record is stored.

sys_created_by.name: sys_created_by
sys_created_by.description: User who initially created the record.

task_created_at.name: task_created_at
task_created_at.description: Date and time when the task record was initially created.

sys_domain_link.name: sys_domain_link
sys_domain_link.description: Link to the system domain associated with the record.

sys_domain_path.name: sys_domain_path
sys_domain_path.description: Path of the system domain associated with the record.

sys_domain_value.name: sys_domain_value
sys_domain_value.description: Value representing the system domain associated with the record.

sys_updated_by.name: sys_updated_by
sys_updated_by.description: User who last updated or modified the record.

task_updated_at.name: task_updated_at
task_updated_at.description: Date and time when the task record was last updated.

task_updated_date.name: task_updated_date
task_updated_date.description: The day the task last got updated.

task_effective_number.name: task_effective_number
task_effective_number.description: Effective number or identifier associated with the task.

upon_approval.name: upon_approval
upon_approval.description: Actions or steps to be taken upon the approval of the task.

upon_reject.name: upon_reject
upon_reject.description: Actions or steps to be taken upon the rejection of the task.

urgency.name: urgency
urgency.description: Level of urgency associated with the record. Speed at which the business expects the record to be resolved.

watch_list.name: watch_list
watch_list.description: List of users or groups who are monitoring or "watching" the task.

work_end.name: work_end
work_end.description: Date and time when the work on the task is scheduled to end.

work_notes.name: work_notes
work_notes.description: Notes or comments recorded during the work on the task.

work_notes_list.name: work_notes_list
work_notes_list.description: List of work notes recorded during the task's lifecycle.

work_start.name: work_start
work_start.description: Date and time when the work on the task is scheduled to start.

cause_notes.name: cause_notes
cause_notes.description: Additional notes or details about the cause of a particular issue or incident.

problem_confirmed_at.name: problem_confirmed_at
problem_confirmed_at.description: The timestamp indicating when the problem was confirmed or acknowledged.

problem_confirmed_by_value.name: problem_confirmed_by_value
problem_confirmed_by_value.description: The name or identifier of the person or entity who confirmed or acknowledged the problem.

problem_first_reported_by_task_link.name: problem_first_reported_by_task_link
problem_first_reported_by_task_link.description: A link to the task or activity that first reported the problem.

problem_first_reported_by_task_value.name: problem_first_reported_by_task_value
problem_first_reported_by_task_value.description: Value representing the related task record.

problem_fix_at.name: problem_fix_at
problem_fix_at.description: The timestamp indicating when the problem is scheduled or planned to be fixed.

problem_fix_by_value.name: problem_fix_by_value
problem_fix_by_value.description: The name or identifier of the person or entity responsible for fixing the problem.

problem_fix_notes.name: problem_fix_notes
problem_fix_notes.description: Additional notes or details related to the fix for the problem.

is_major_problem.name: is_major_problem
is_major_problem.description: Indicates whether the issue is categorized as a major problem.

problem_state.name: problem_state
problem_state.description: The current state or status of the problem or issue.

problem_related_incidents.name: problem_related_incidents
problem_related_incidents.description: Number of incidents that are related to the current problem.

problem_resolution_code.name: problem_resolution_code
problem_resolution_code.description: The code or identifier associated with the resolution of the problem.

problem_resolved_at.name: problem_resolved_at
problem_resolved_at.description: The timestamp indicating when the problem was resolved.

problem_resolved_by_value.name: problem_resolved_by_value
problem_resolved_by_value.description: The name or identifier of the person or entity who resolved the problem.

problem_subcategory.name: problem_subcategory
problem_subcategory.description: The specific subcategory or classification of the issue, providing more detailed information about its nature.

problem_created_at.name: problem_created_at
problem_created_at.description: Date and time when the problem record was initially created.

problem_updated_at.name: problem_updated_at
problem_updated_at.description: Date and time when the problem record was last updated.

workaround_applied.name: workaround_applied
workaround_applied.description: Indicates whether a workaround has been applied to address the issue.

problem_task_cause_code.name: problem_task_cause_code
problem_task_cause_code.description: The code or identifier associated with the cause of the issue or problem.

problem_task_close_code.name: problem_task_close_code
problem_task_close_code.description: The code or identifier associated with the closure or resolution of the problem task.

problem_task_type.name: problem_task_type
problem_task_type.description: The type or category of the task associated with the problem or issue.

problem_task_started_at.name: problem_task_started_at
problem_task_started_at.description: The timestamp indicating when the issue or incident was initiated or started.

started_by_value.name: started_by_value
started_by_value.description: The name or identifier of the person or entity who initiated or started the issue or incident.

change_task_type.name: change_task_type
change_task_type.description: The type or category of the task associated with the change request or change record.

change_task_close_code.name: change_task_close_code
change_task_close_code.description: The code or identifier associated with the closure or resolution of the change task.

change_task_created_from.name: change_task_created_from
change_task_created_from.description: Information about the source or origin of the current record, indicating how it was created or generated.

is_change_on_hold.name: is_change_on_hold
is_change_on_hold.description: Indicates whether the change task is currently on hold or paused.

change_on_hold_reason.name: change_on_hold_reason
change_on_hold_reason.description: The reason or rationale for placing the associated record on hold.

change_task_planned_end_date.name: change_task_planned_end_date
change_task_planned_end_date.description: The planned or scheduled end date for the change request or change record.

change_task_planned_start_date.name: change_task_planned_start_date
change_task_planned_start_date.description: The planned or scheduled start date for the change request or change record.

change_plan.name: change_plan
change_plan.description: Information about the plan or process for implementing the changes associated with the current record.

change_request_close_code.name: change_request_close_code
change_request_close_code.description: The code or identifier associated with the closure or resolution.

change_request_end_date.name: change_request_end_date
change_request_end_date.description: The end date for the implementation or execution associated with the current record.

change_request_implementation_plan.name: change_request_implementation_plan
change_request_implementation_plan.description: Information about the plan or process for implementing the changes associated with the current record.

change_request_justification.name: change_request_justification
change_request_justification.description: The reasoning or justification behind the changes associated with the current record, providing context or explanation for the modifications made.

is_change_request_on_hold.name: is_change_request_on_hold
is_change_request_on_hold.description: Indicates whether the change is currently on hold or paused.

change_request_on_hold_reason.name: change_request_on_hold_reason
change_request_on_hold_reason.description: The reason or rationale for placing the change on hold.

change_request_phase.name: change_request_phase
change_request_phase.description: The phase or stage of the change request or change record within the change management process, indicating its progress or status.

change_request_phase_state.name: change_request_phase_state
change_request_phase_state.description: The current state or status of the phase associated with the change request or change record.

change_request_reason.name: change_request_reason
change_request_reason.description: The reason or rationale behind the changes associated with the current record, providing context or explanation for the modifications made.

change_requested_by_value.name: change_requested_by_value
change_requested_by_value.description: The name or identifier of the person or entity who requested or initiated the changes associated with the current record.

change_requested_by_date.name: change_requested_by_date
change_requested_by_date.description: The date the change is requested for.

change_request_review_date.name: change_request_review_date
change_request_review_date.description: The date when the change request was reviewed or evaluated.

change_request_review_status.name: change_request_review_status
change_request_review_status.description: The status or outcome of the review process for the change request associated with the current record.

change_request_risk.name: change_request_risk
change_request_risk.description: The level of risk associated with the changes, indicating the potential impact or consequences of implementing the modifications outlined in the current record.

change_request_scope.name: change_request_scope

model.servicenow.servicenow__task_enhanc.raw_code:
with task as (
  select *
  from {{ ref('stg_servicenow__task') }}
),

problem_task as (
  select *
  from {{ ref('stg_servicenow__problem_task') }}
),

problem as (
  select *
  from {{ ref('stg_servicenow__problem') }}
),

change_task as (
  select *
  from {{ ref('stg_servicenow__change_task') }}
),

change_request as (
  select *
  from {{ ref('stg_servicenow__change_request') }}
),

sys_user as (
  select *
  from {{ ref('stg_servicenow__sys_user') }}
),

sys_user_group as (
  select *
  from {{ ref('stg_servicenow__sys_user_group') }}
),

core_company as (
  select *
  from {{ ref('stg_servicenow__core_company') }}
),

cmdb_ci as (
  select *
  from {{ ref('stg_servicenow__cmdb_ci') }}
),

cmdb_ci_service as (
  select *
  from {{ ref('stg_servicenow__cmdb_ci_service') }}
),

sys_choice as (
  select *
  from {{ ref('stg_servicenow__sys_choice') }}
  where sys_choice_name = 'task'
),

task_enhanced as (
  select 
    task.task_id,
    task.is_task_active,
    task.task_description,
    task.activity_due,
    task.priority,
    priority_choice.label as dv_priority_label,
    task.impact,
    impact_choice.label as dv_impact_label,
    task.urgency,
    urgency_choice.label as dv_urgency_label,
    task.task_state,
    state_choice.label as dv_task_state_label,
    task.task_number,
    task.task_order,
    cast( (case when problem_task.problem_task_id is not null 
      then true 
      else false 
    end) as {{ dbt.type_boolean() }}) as is_problem_task,
    cast( (case when change_task.change_task_id is not null 
      then true 
      else false 
    end) as {{ dbt.type_boolean() }}) as is_change_task,
    task.task_created_at,
    task.sys_created_by,
    task.cmdb_ci_link,
    task.cmdb_ci_value,
    cmdb_ci.cmdb_ci_name,
    creator.email as creator_email,
    creator.manager_value as creator_manager_value,
    creator.department_value as creator_department_value,
    creator.sys_user_name as creator_name,
    creator.sys_user_roles as creator_roles,
    task.task_updated_at,
    cast ({{ dbt.date_trunc('day', 'task.task_updated_at') }} as date) as task_updated_date,
    task.sys_updated_by,
    updater.email as updater_email,
    updater.manager_value as updater_manager_value,
    updater.department_value as updater_department_value,
    updater.sys_user_name as updater_name,
    updater.sys_user_roles as updater_roles,
    task.task_opened_at,
    task.opened_by_link,
    task.opened_by_value, 
    opener.manager_value as opener_manager_value,
    opener.email as opener_email,
    opener.department_value as opener_department_value,
    opener.sys_user_name as opener_name,
    opener.sys_user_roles as opener_roles,
    task.assigned_to_link, 
    task.assigned_to_value,
    assignee.email as assignee_email,
    assignee.manager_value as assignee_manager_value,
    assignee.department_value as assignee_department_value,
    assignee.sys_user_name as assignee_name,
    assignee.sys_user_roles as assignee_roles,
    task.task_closed_at,
    {{ dbt.datediff("cast(task.task_opened_at as " ~ dbt.type_timestamp() ~ " ) ", "cast(task.task_closed_at as " ~ dbt.type_timestamp() ~ " ) ", 'minute') }} as task_minutes_open_to_close,
    task.closed_by_link,
    task.closed_by_value,
    closer.email as closer_email,
    closer.manager_value as closer_manager_value,
    closer.department_value as closer_department_value,
    closer.sys_user_name as closer_name,
    closer.sys_user_roles as closer_roles,
    task.task_effective_number,
    task.additional_assignee_list,
    task.approval,
    task.approval_history,
    task.approval_set,
    task.assignment_group_link,
    task.assignment_group_value,
    assignment_group.sys_user_group_name as assignment_group_name,
    task.business_duration,
    task.business_duration_sec,
    task.calendar_duration,
    task.calendar_duration_sec,
    task.business_service_link,
    task.business_service_value,
    business_service.cmdb_ci_service_name as business_service_name,
    task.close_notes,
    task.comments,
    task.comments_and_work_notes,
    task.company_link,
    task.company_value, 
    core_company.company_name,
    task.contact_type, 
    task.task_due_date_at,
    task.expected_start,
    task.task_follow_up_at,
    task.group_list,
    task.knowledge,
    task.is_made_sla,
    task.sla_due,
    task.parent_link, 
    task.parent_value,
    task.reassignment_count,
    task.route_reason,
    task.short_description,
    task.sys_class_name,
    task.sys_domain_link,
    task.sys_domain_path,
    task.sys_domain_value,
    task.upon_approval,
    task.upon_reject,
    task.watch_list,
    task.work_start,
    task.work_end,
    task.work_notes,
    task.work_notes_list,
    problem_task.problem_task_cause_code,
    problem_task.problem_task_close_code,
    problem_task.problem_task_type,
    problem_task.problem_task_started_at,
    problem_task.started_by_value,
    problem_task_starter.email as problem_task_starter_email,
    problem_task_starter.manager_value as problem_task_starter_manager_value,
    problem_task_starter.department_value as problem_task_starter_department_value,
    problem_task_starter.sys_user_name as problem_task_starter_name,
    problem_task_starter.sys_user_roles as problem_task_starter_roles, 
    problem.problem_id as associated_problem_id,
    problem.problem_category,
    problem.cause_notes,
    problem.problem_confirmed_at,
    problem.problem_confirmed_by_value,
    problem_confirmer.email as problem_confirmer_email,
    problem_confirmer.manager_value as problem_confirmer_manager_value,
    problem_confirmer.department_value as problem_confirmer_department_value,
    problem_confirmer.sys_user_name as problem_confirmer_name,
    problem_confirmer.sys_user_roles as problem_confirmer_roles,
    problem.problem_first_reported_by_task_link,
    problem.problem_first_reported_by_task_value,
    problem.problem_fix_at,
    problem.problem_fix_by_value,
    problem_fixer.email as problem_fixer_email,
    problem_fixer.manager_value as problem_fixer_manager_value,
    problem_fixer.department_value as problem_fixer_department_value,
    problem_fixer.sys_user_name as problem_fixer_name,
    problem_fixer.sys_user_roles as problem_fixer_roles,
    problem.problem_fix_notes,
    problem.is_known_error as problem_is_known_error,
    problem.is_major_problem,
    problem.problem_state,
    problem.problem_related_incidents,
    problem.problem_resolution_code,
    problem.problem_resolved_at,
    problem.problem_resolved_by_value,
    problem.workaround_applied,
    problem_resolver.email as problem_resolver_email,
    problem_resolver.manager_value as problem_resolver_manager_value,
    problem_resolver.department_value as problem_resolver_department_value,
    problem_resolver.sys_user_name as problem_resolver_name,
    problem_resolver.sys_user_roles as problem_resolver_roles,
    problem.problem_subcategory,
    problem.problem_created_at,
    problem.problem_updated_at,
    change_task.change_task_type,
    change_task.change_task_close_code,
    change_task.change_task_created_from,
    change_task.is_change_on_hold,
    change_task.change_on_hold_reason,
    change_task.change_task_planned_end_date,
    change_task.change_task_planned_start_date,
    change_request.change_request_id as associated_change_request_id,
    change_request.change_request_created_at,
    change_request.change_request_updated_at,
    change_request.change_request_category,
    change_request.change_plan,
    change_request.change_request_close_code,
    change_request.change_request_end_date,
    change_request.change_request_implementation_plan,
    change_request.change_request_justification,
    change_request.is_change_request_on_hold,
    change_request.change_request_on_hold_reason,
    change_request.change_request_phase,
    change_request.change_request_phase_state,
    change_request.change_request_reason,
    change_request.change_requested_by_date,
    change_request.change_requested_by_value,
    change_requester.email as change_requester_email,
    change_requester.manager_value as change_requester_manager_value,
    change_requester.department_value as change_requester_department_value,
    change_requester.sys_user_name as change_requester_name,
    change_requester.sys_user_roles as change_requester_roles,
    change_request.change_request_review_date,
    change_request.change_request_review_status,
    change_request.change_request_risk,
    change_request.change_request_scope,
    change_request.change_request_start_date,
    change_request.change_request_test_plan,
    change_request.change_request_type,
    change_request.is_change_request_unauthorized,
    task.source_relation

from task
left join core_company
  on task.company_value = core_company.core_company_id
  and task.source_relation = core_company.source_relation
left join problem_task
  on task.task_id = problem_task.problem_task_id
  and task.source_relation = problem_task.source_relation
left join sys_user problem_task_starter
  on problem_task.started_by_value = problem_task_starter.sys_user_id
  and problem_task.source_relation = problem_task_starter.source_relation
left join problem
  on problem_task.problem_value = problem.problem_id
  and problem_task.source_relation = problem.source_relation
left join sys_user problem_confirmer
  on problem.problem_confirmed_by_value = problem_confirmer.sys_user_id
  and problem.source_relation = problem_confirmer.source_relation
left join sys_user problem_fixer
  on problem.problem_fix_by_value = problem_fixer.sys_user_id
  and problem.source_relation = problem_fixer.source_relation
left join sys_user problem_resolver
  on problem.problem_resolved_by_value = problem_resolver.sys_user_id
  and problem.source_relation = problem_resolver.source_relation
left join change_task
  on task.task_id = change_task.change_task_id
  and task.source_relation = change_task.source_relation
left join change_request
  on change_task.change_request_value = change_request.change_request_id
  and change_task.source_relation = change_request.source_relation
left join sys_user change_requester
  on change_request.change_requested_by_value = change_requester.sys_user_id
  and change_request.source_relation = change_requester.source_relation
left join sys_user assignee
  on task.assigned_to_value = assignee.sys_user_id
  and task.source_relation = assignee.source_relation
left join sys_user closer 
  on task.closed_by_value = closer.sys_user_id
  and task.source_relation = closer.source_relation
left join sys_user opener
  on task.opened_by_value = opener.sys_user_id
  and task.source_relation = opener.source_relation
left join sys_user creator
  on lower(task.sys_created_by) = lower(creator.user_name)
  and task.source_relation = creator.source_relation
left join sys_user updater
  on lower(task.sys_updated_by) = lower(updater.user_name)
  and task.source_relation = updater.source_relation
left join sys_user_group assignment_group
  on task.assignment_group_value = assignment_group.sys_user_group_id
  and task.source_relation = assignment_group.source_relation
left join cmdb_ci
  on task.cmdb_ci_value = cmdb_ci.cmdb_ci_id
  and task.source_relation = cmdb_ci.source_relation
left join cmdb_ci_service business_service
  on task.business_service_value = business_service.cmdb_ci_service_id
  and task.source_relation = business_service.source_relation
left join sys_choice state_choice
  on task.task_state = state_choice.sys_choice_value
  and state_choice.element = 'state'
  and task.source_relation = state_choice.source_relation
left join sys_choice priority_choice
  on task.priority = priority_choice.sys_choice_value
  and priority_choice.element = 'priority'
  and task.source_relation = priority_choice.source_relation
left join sys_choice impact_choice
  on task.impact = impact_choice.sys_choice_value
  and impact_choice.element = 'impact'
  and task.source_relation = impact_choice.source_relation
left join sys_choice urgency_choice
  on task.urgency = urgency_choice.sys_choice_value
  and urgency_choice.element = 'urgency'
  and task.source_relation = urgency_choice.source_relation
)

select *
from task_enhanced

    cast (date_trunc('day', task.task_updated_at) as date) as task_updated_date,

    updater.email as updater_email,
    updater.manager_value as updater_manager_value,
    updater.department_value as updater_department_value,
    updater.sys_user_name as updater_name,
    updater.sys_user_roles as updater_roles,
    task.task_opened_at,
    task.opened_by_link,
    task.opened_by_value, 
    opener.manager_value as opener_manager_value,
    opener.email as opener_email,
    opener.department_value as opener_department_value,
    opener.sys_user_name as opener_name,
    opener.sys_user_roles as opener_roles,
    task.assigned_to_link, 
    task.assigned_to_value,
    assignee.email as assignee_email,
    assignee.manager_value as assignee_manager_value,
    assignee.department_value as assignee_department_value,
    assignee.sys_user_name as assignee_name,
    assignee.sys_user_roles as assignee_roles,
    task.task_closed_at,
    
        (
        (
        ((cast(task.task_closed_at as timestamp ) )::date - (cast(task.task_opened_at as timestamp ) )::date)
     * 24 + date_part('hour', (cast(task.task_closed_at as timestamp ) )::timestamp) - date_part('hour', (cast(task.task_opened_at as timestamp ) )::timestamp))
     * 60 + date_part('minute', (cast(task.task_closed_at as timestamp ) )::timestamp) - date_part('minute', (cast(task.task_opened_at as timestamp ) )::timestamp))
     as task_minutes_open_to_close,
    task.closed_by_link,
    task.closed_by_value,
    closer.email as closer_email,
    closer.manager_value as closer_manager_value,
    closer.department_value as closer_department_value,
    closer.sys_user_name as closer_name,
    closer.sys_user_roles as closer_roles,
    task.task_effective_number,
    task.additional_assignee_list,
    task.approval,
    task.approval_history,
    task.approval_set,
    task.assignment_group_link,
    task.assignment_group_value,
    assignment_group.sys_user_group_name as assignment_group_name,
    task.business_duration,
    task.business_duration_sec,
    task.calendar_duration,
    task.calendar_duration_sec,
    task.business_service_link,
    task.business_service_value,
    business_service.cmdb_ci_service_name as business_service_name,
    task.close_notes,
    task.comments,
    task.comments_and_work_notes,
    task.company_link,
    task.company_value, 
    core_company.company_name,
    task.contact_type, 
    task.task_due_date_at,
    task.expected_start,
    task.task_follow_up_at,
    task.group_list,
    task.knowledge,
    task.is_made_sla,
    task.sla_due,
    task.parent_link, 
    task.parent_value,
    task.reassignment_count,
    task.route_reason,
    task.short_description,
    task.sys_class_name,
    task.sys_domain_link,
    task.sys_domain_path,
    task.sys_domain_value,
    task.upon_approval,
    task.upon_reject,
    task.watch_list,
    task.work_start,
    task.work_end,
    task.work_notes,
    task.work_notes_list,
    problem_task.problem_task_cause_code,
    problem_task.problem_task_close_code,
    problem_task.problem_task_type,
    problem_task.problem_task_started_at,
    problem_task.started_by_value,
    problem_task_starter.email as problem_task_starter_email,
    problem_task_starter.manager_value as problem_task_starter_manager_value,
    problem_task_starter.department_value as problem_task_starter_department_value,
    problem_task_starter.sys_user_name as problem_task_starter_name,
    problem_task_starter.sys_user_roles as problem_task_starter_roles, 
    problem.problem_id as associated_problem_id,
    problem.problem_category,
    problem.cause_notes,
    problem.problem_confirmed_at,
    problem.problem_confirmed_by_value,
    problem_confirmer.email as problem_confirmer_email,
    problem_confirmer.manager_value as problem_confirmer_manager_value,
    problem_confirmer.department_value as problem_confirmer_department_value,
    problem_confirmer.sys_user_name as problem_confirmer_name,
    problem_confirmer.sys_user_roles as problem_confirmer_roles,
    problem.problem_first_reported_by_task_link,
    problem.problem_first_reported_by_task_value,
    problem.problem_fix_at,
    problem.problem_fix_by_value,
    problem_fixer.email as problem_fixer_email,
    problem_fixer.manager_value as problem_fixer_manager_value,
    problem_fixer.department_value as problem_fixer_department_value,
    problem_fixer.sys_user_name as problem_fixer_name,
    problem_fixer.sys_user_roles as problem_fixer_roles,
    problem.problem_fix_notes,
    problem.is_known_error as problem_is_known_error,
    problem.is_major_problem,
    problem.problem_state,
    problem.problem_related_incidents,
    problem.problem_resolution_code,
    problem.problem_resolved_at,
    problem.problem_resolved_by_value,
    problem.workaround_applied,
    problem_resolver.email as problem_resolver_email,
    problem_resolver.manager_value as problem_resolver_manager_value,
    problem_resolver.department_value as problem_resolver_department_value,
    problem_resolver.sys_user_name as problem_resolver_name,
    problem_resolver.sys_user_roles as problem_resolver_roles,
    problem.problem_subcategory,
    problem.problem_created_at,
    problem.problem_updated_at,
    change_task.change_task_type,
    change_task.change_task_close_code,
    change_task.change_task_created_from,
    change_task.is_change_on_hold,
    change_task.change_on_hold_reason,
    change_task.change_task_planned_end_date,
    change_task.change_task_planned_start_date,
    change_request.change_request_id as associated_change_request_id,
    change_request.change_request_created_at,
    change_request.change_request_updated_at,
    change_request.change_request_category,
    change_request.change_plan,
    change_request.change_request_close_code,
    change_request.change_request_end_date,
    change_request.change_request_implementation_plan,
    change_request.change_request_justification,
    change_request.is_change_request_on_hold,
    change_request.change_request_on_hold_reason,
    change_request.change_request_phase,
    change_request.change_request_phase_state,
    change_request.change_request_reason,
    change_request.change_requested_by_date,
    change_request.change_requested_by_value,
    change_requester.email as change_requester_email,
    change_requester.manager_value as change_requester_manager_value,
    change_requester.department_value as change_requester_department_value,
    change_requester.sys_user_name as change_requester_name,
    change_requester.sys_user_roles as change_requester_roles,
    change_request.change_request_review_date,
    change_request.change_request_review_status,
    change_request.change_request_risk,
    change_request.change_request_scope,
    change_request.change_request_start_date,
    change_request.change_request_test_plan,
    change_request.change_request_type,
    change_request.is_change_request_unauthorized,
    task.source_relation

from task
left join core_company
  on task.company_value = core_company.core_company_id
  and task.source_relation = core_company.source_relation
left join problem_task
  on task.task_id = problem_task.problem_task_id
  and task.source_relation = problem_task.source_relation
left join sys_user problem_task_starter
  on problem_task.started_by_value = problem_task_starter.sys_user_id
  and problem_task.source_relation = problem_task_starter.source_relation
left join problem
  on problem_task.problem_value = problem.problem_id
  and problem_task.source_relation = problem.source_relation
left join sys_user problem_confirmer
  on problem.problem_confirmed_by_value = problem_confirmer.sys_user_id
  and problem.source_relation = problem_confirmer.source_relation
left join sys_user problem_fixer
  on problem.problem_fix_by_value = problem_fixer.sys_user_id
  and problem.source_relation = problem_fixer.source_relation
left join sys_user problem_resolver
  on problem.problem_resolved_by_value = problem_resolver.sys_user_id
  and problem.source_relation = problem_resolver.source_relation
left join change_task
  on task.task_id = change_task.change_task_id
  and task.source_relation = change_task.source_relation
left join change_request
  on change_task.change_request_value = change_request.change_request_id
  and change_task.source_relation = change_request.source_relation
left join sys_user change_requester
  on change_request.change_requested_by_value = change_requester.sys_user_id
  and change_request.source_relation = change_requester.source_relation
left join sys_user assignee
  on task.assigned_to_value = assignee.sys_user_id
  and task.source_relation = assignee.source_relation
left join sys_user closer 
  on task.closed_by_value = closer.sys_user_id
  and task.source_relation = closer.source_relation
left join sys_user opener
  on task.opened_by_value = opener.sys_user_id
  and task.source_relation = opener.source_relation
left join sys_user creator
  on lower(task.sys_created_by) = lower(creator.user_name)
  and task.source_relation = creator.source_relation
left join sys_user updater
  on lower(task.sys_updated_by) = lower(updater.user_name)
  and task.source_relation = updater.source_relation
left join sys_user_group assignment_group
  on task.assignment_group_value = assignment_group.sys_user_group_id
  and task.source_relation = assignment_group.source_relation
left join cmdb_ci
  on task.cmdb_ci_value = cmdb_ci.cmdb_ci_id
  and task.source_relation = cmdb_ci.source_relation
left join cmdb_ci_service business_service
  on task.business_service_value = business_service.cmdb_ci_service_id
  and task.source_relation = business_service.source_relation
left join sys_choice state_choice
  on task.task_state = state_choice.sys_choice_value
  and state_choice.element = 'state'
  and task.source_relation = state_choice.source_relation
left join sys_choice priority_choice
  on task.priority = priority_choice.sys_choice_value
  and priority_choice.element = 'priority'
  and task.source_relation = priority_choice.source_relation
left join sys_choice impact_choice
  on task.impact = impact_choice.sys_choice_value
  and impact_choice.element = 'impact'
  and task.source_relation = impact_choice.source_relation
left join sys_choice urgency_choice
  on task.urgency = urgency_choice.sys_choice_value
  and urgency_choice.element = 'urgency'
  and task.source_relation = urgency_choice.source_relation
)

select *
from task_enhanced

model.servicenow.servicenow__activity_su.name: servicenow__activity_summary
model.servicenow.servicenow__activity_su.description: Each record represents aggregate task, problem, change, incident, and change request data by varying grains including update date, status, priority, impact, and urgency.

task_updated_date.name: task_updated_date
task_updated_date.description: The day the task last got updated.

task_state.name: task_state
task_state.description: Current state or status of the task (e.g., in progress, on hold, closed).

priority.name: priority
priority.description: Priority level assigned to the task. The priority field is automatically calculated based on the values of impact and urgency. This determines the sequence in which the record should be resolved.

impact.name: impact
impact.description: Assessment of the impact that completing or not completing the task may have. This is the business loss and potential damage (for example, financial, customer, regulation, security, reputation, brand) caused by the incident

urgency.name: urgency
urgency.description: Level of urgency associated with the record. Speed at which the business expects the record to be resolved.

source_relation.name: source_relation
source_relation.description: Indicates the schema which the field originated. This is especially important when leveraging the union schema feature.

total_active_problem_tasks.name: total_active_problem_tasks
total_active_problem_tasks.description: Total number of active problem tasks

total_active_change_tasks.name: total_active_change_tasks
total_active_change_tasks.description: Total number of active change tasks

total_incidents_caused_by_problems.name: total_incidents_caused_by_problems
total_incidents_caused_by_problems.description: Total number of incidents caused by associated problems

average_minutes_open_to_close.name: average_minutes_open_to_close
average_minutes_open_to_close.description: Average number of minutes between the time that the task was opened to the time that the task was closed.

total_tasks_made_slas.name: total_tasks_made_slas
total_tasks_made_slas.description: The count of total tasks where is_made_sla = True

model.servicenow.servicenow__activity_su.raw_code:
with ticket_enhanced as (

    select * 
    from {{ ref('servicenow__task_enhanced') }}
)

select 
    task_updated_date,
    task_state,
    priority,
    impact,
    urgency,
    source_relation,
    count(distinct case when is_task_active = true then task_id end) as total_active_tasks,
    count(distinct case when is_problem_task = true and is_task_active = true then task_id end) as total_active_problem_tasks,
    count(distinct case when is_change_task = true and is_task_active = true then task_id end) as total_active_change_tasks,
    count(distinct associated_problem_id) as total_associated_problems, 
    sum(problem_related_incidents) as total_incidents_caused_by_problems,
    count(distinct associated_change_request_id) as total_change_requests,
    count(distinct case when task_closed_at is not null then task_id end) as total_closed_tasks,
    avg(task_minutes_open_to_close) as average_minutes_open_to_close,
    count(case when is_made_sla = true then 1 end) as total_tasks_made_slas

from ticket_enhanced
group by 1,2,3,4,5,6
model.servicenow.servicenow__activity_su.compiled_code:
with ticket_enhanced as (

)

select 
    task_updated_date,
    task_state,
    priority,
    impact,
    urgency,
    source_relation,
    count(distinct case when is_task_active = true then task_id end) as total_active_tasks,
    count(distinct case when is_problem_task = true and is_task_active = true then task_id end) as total_active_problem_tasks,
    count(distinct case when is_change_task = true and is_task_active = true then task_id end) as total_active_change_tasks,
    count(distinct associated_problem_id) as total_associated_problems, 
    sum(problem_related_incidents) as total_incidents_caused_by_problems,
    count(distinct associated_change_request_id) as total_change_requests,
    count(distinct case when task_closed_at is not null then task_id end) as total_closed_tasks,
    avg(task_minutes_open_to_close) as average_minutes_open_to_close,
    count(case when is_made_sla = true then 1 end) as total_tasks_made_slas

from ticket_enhanced
group by 1,2,3,4,5,6

model.servicenow.servicenow__change_requ.name: servicenow__change_request_enhanced
model.servicenow.servicenow__change_requ.description: Each record represents a change request with additional information about users who have interacted with it, pertinent task data, and relevant timestamps.

change_request_type.name: change_request_type
change_request_type.description: The type or category of the changes outlined in the current record, indicating the nature or purpose of the modifications.

change_request_created_at.name: change_request_created_at
change_request_created_at.description: Date and time when the record was initially created.

change_request_updated_at.name: change_request_updated_at
change_request_updated_at.description: Date and time when the record was last updated.

change_request_updated_date.name: change_request_updated_date
change_request_updated_date.description: Date the record was last updated.

change_request_start_date.name: change_request_start_date
change_request_start_date.description: The requested start date for the implementation or execution of the changes associated with the current record.

change_requested_by_date.name: change_requested_by_date
change_requested_by_date.description: The date the change is requested for.

change_requested_by_link.name: change_requested_by_link
change_requested_by_link.description: A link to the person or entity who requested or initiated the changes associated with the current record.

change_requested_by_value.name: change_requested_by_value
change_requested_by_value.description: The name or identifier of the person or entity who requested or initiated the changes associated with the current record.

change_request_review_date.name: change_request_review_date
change_request_review_date.description: The date when the record was reviewed or evaluated.

change_request_review_status.name: change_request_review_status
change_request_review_status.description: The status or outcome of the review process associated with the current record.

review_comments.name: review_comments
review_comments.description: Comments or feedback provided during the review process for the changes associated with the current record.

change_plan.name: change_plan
change_plan.description: Information about the plan or process for implementing the changes associated with the current record.

backout_plan.name: backout_plan
backout_plan.description: Information about the plan or process for backing out or undoing the changes associated with the current record.

chg_model_link.name: chg_model_link
chg_model_link.description: A link to the change model or template associated with the change request or change record.

chg_model_value.name: chg_model_value
chg_model_value.description: The name or identifier of the change model or template linked to the change request or change record.

change_request_close_code.name: change_request_close_code
change_request_close_code.description: The code or identifier associated with the closure or resolution.

conflict_last_run.name: conflict_last_run
conflict_last_run.description: The timestamp indicating when the conflict detection was last run for the change request or change record.

conflict_status.name: conflict_status
conflict_status.description: The status or outcome of the conflict detection process for the change request or change record.

change_request_phase.name: change_request_phase
change_request_phase.description: The phase or stage of the change request or change record within the change management process, indicating its progress or status.

change_request_phase_state.name: change_request_phase_state
change_request_phase_state.description: The current state or status of the phase associated with the change request or change record.

change_request_implementation_plan.name: change_request_implementation_plan
change_request_implementation_plan.description: Information about the plan or process for implementing the changes associated with the current record.

change_request_justification.name: change_request_justification
change_request_justification.description: The reasoning or justification behind the changes associated with the current record, providing context or explanation for the modifications made.

is_change_request_on_hold.name: is_change_request_on_hold
is_change_request_on_hold.description: Indicates whether the change is currently on hold or paused.

change_request_on_hold_reason.name: change_request_on_hold_reason
change_request_on_hold_reason.description: The reason or rationale for placing the associated record on hold.

on_hold_task.name: on_hold_task
on_hold_task.description:
A link to the task or activity that indicates the current record is on hold, specifying the task associated with the 
hold status.

outside_maintenance_schedule.name: outside_maintenance_schedule
outside_maintenance_schedule.description: Indicates whether the changes associated with the current record fall outside the regular maintenance schedule or window.

is_production_system.name: is_production_system
is_production_system.description: Indicates whether the changes associated with the current record are intended for the production environment or system.

change_request_reason.name: change_request_reason
change_request_reason.description: The reason or rationale behind the changes requested by the current record, providing context or explanation for the modifications made.

change_request_risk.name: change_request_risk
change_request_risk.description: The level of risk associated with the changes, indicating the potential impact or consequences of implementing the modifications outlined in the current record.

risk_impact_analysis.name: risk_impact_analysis
risk_impact_analysis.description: An analysis or assessment of the impact or consequences of the changes outlined in the current record.

change_request_scope.name: change_request_scope
change_request_scope.description: The scope or extent of the changes outlined in the current record, specifying the areas or components affected by the modifications.

change_request_test_plan.name: change_request_test_plan
change_request_test_plan.description: Information about the plan or process for testing the changes associated with the current record.

is_change_request_unauthorized.name: is_change_request_unauthorized
is_change_request_unauthorized.description: Indicates whether the changes associated with the current record were made without proper authorization or approval.

cab_date.name: cab_date
cab_date.description: The date of the Change Advisory Board (CAB) meeting associated with the change request or change record.

cab_date_time.name: cab_date_time
cab_date_time.description: The date and time of the Change Advisory Board (CAB) meeting associated with the change request or change record.

cab_delegate_link.name: cab_delegate_link
cab_delegate_link.description:
A link to the person or entity delegated to represent or act on behalf of the Change Advisory Board (CAB) in relation 
to the change request.

cab_delegate_value.name: cab_delegate_value
cab_delegate_value.description:
The name or identifier of the person or entity delegated to represent or act on behalf of the Change Advisory Board (CAB) 
in relation to the change request.

cab_recommendation.name: cab_recommendation
cab_recommendation.description: The recommendation or decision made by the Change Advisory Board (CAB) regarding the change request.

is_cab_required.name: is_cab_required
is_cab_required.description: Indicates whether the Change Advisory Board (CAB) approval is required for the change request.

_fivetran_synced.name: _fivetran_synced
_fivetran_synced.description: Indicates whether the task record has been synchronized by the Fivetran connector.

change_requestor_email.name: change_requestor_email
change_requestor_email.description: Email address associated with the record.

change_requestor_manager_value.name: change_requestor_manager_value
change_requestor_manager_value.description: The name or identifier of the user's manager or supervisor.

change_requestor_department_value.name: change_requestor_department_value
change_requestor_department_value.description: Value representing the department associated with the system user.

change_requestor_name.name: change_requestor_name
change_requestor_name.description: The system username or identifier for the user.

change_requestor_roles.name: change_requestor_roles
change_requestor_roles.description: The roles assigned to the user in the system or organization.

change_request_days_created_to_reviewed.name: change_request_days_created_to_reviewed
change_request_days_created_to_reviewed.description: The days lapsed from when the change request was created to when it was reviewed

change_request_days_created_to_start.name: change_request_days_created_to_start
change_request_days_created_to_start.description: The days lapsed from when the change request was created to when it was started

change_request_days_requested_by_to_star.name: change_request_days_requested_by_to_start
change_request_days_requested_by_to_star.description: The days lapsed from when the change request was requested to when it was started

total_related_tasks.name: total_related_tasks
total_related_tasks.description: The total number of tasks tied to this record.

source_relation.name: source_relation
source_relation.description: Indicates the schema which the field originated. This is especially important when leveraging the union schema feature.

dv_change_request_type_label.name: dv_change_request_type_label
dv_change_request_type_label.description: The display value (viewable in the ServiceNow UI), or human-readable text, for a titular choice option.

dv_change_request_phase_state_label.name: dv_change_request_phase_state_label
dv_change_request_phase_state_label.description: The display value (viewable in the ServiceNow UI), or human-readable text, for a titular choice option.

dv_change_request_risk_label.name: dv_change_request_risk_label
dv_change_request_risk_label.description: The display value (viewable in the ServiceNow UI), or human-readable text, for a titular choice option.

model.servicenow.servicenow__change_requ.raw_code:
with change_request as (
    select * 
    from {{ ref('stg_servicenow__change_request') }}
),

change_task as (
    select
        change_request_value,
        source_relation,
        count(change_task_id) as total_tasks
    from {{ ref('stg_servicenow__change_task') }}
    group by 1,2
),

sys_user as (
    select *
    from {{ ref('stg_servicenow__sys_user') }}
),

sys_choice as (
    select *
    from {{ ref('stg_servicenow__sys_choice') }}
    where sys_choice_name = 'change_request'
),

change_request_enhanced as (
    select
        change_request.change_request_id,
        change_request.change_request_category,
        change_request.change_request_type,
        type_choice.label as dv_change_request_type_label,
        change_request.change_request_created_at,
        change_request.change_request_created_date,
        change_request.change_request_updated_at,
        change_request.change_request_updated_date,
        change_request.change_request_start_date,
        change_request.change_requested_by_date,
        change_request.change_requested_by_link,
        change_request.change_requested_by_value,
        change_requestor.email as change_requestor_email,
        change_requestor.manager_value as change_requestor_manager_value,
        change_requestor.department_value as change_requestor_department_value,
        change_requestor.sys_user_name as change_requestor_name,
        change_requestor.sys_user_roles as change_requestor_roles,
        change_request.change_request_review_date,
        change_request.change_request_review_status,
        change_request.review_comments,
        change_request.change_plan,
        change_request.backout_plan,
        change_request.chg_model_link,
        change_request.chg_model_value,
        change_request.change_request_close_code,
        change_request.conflict_last_run,
        change_request.conflict_status,
        change_request.change_request_phase,
        change_request.change_request_phase_state,

        change_request.on_hold_task,

        change_request.is_production_system,
        change_request.change_request_reason,
        change_request.change_request_risk,
        risk_choice.label as dv_change_request_risk_label,
        change_request.risk_impact_analysis,
        change_request.change_request_scope,
        change_request.change_request_test_plan,
        change_request.is_change_request_unauthorized,
        change_request.cab_date,
        change_request.cab_date_time,
        change_request.cab_delegate_link,
        change_request.cab_delegate_value,
        change_request.cab_recommendation,
        change_request.is_cab_required,
        change_request._fivetran_synced,
        {{ dbt.datediff("cast(change_request.change_request_created_date as " ~ dbt.type_timestamp() ~ " ) ", "cast(change_request.change_request_start_date as " ~ dbt.type_timestamp() ~ " ) ", 'day') }} as change_request_days_created_to_start,
        {{ dbt.datediff("cast(change_request.change_requested_by_date as " ~ dbt.type_timestamp() ~ " ) " , "cast(change_request.change_request_start_date as " ~ dbt.type_timestamp() ~ " ) ", 'day') }} as change_request_days_requested_by_to_start, 
        {{ dbt.datediff("cast(change_request.change_request_created_date as " ~ dbt.type_timestamp() ~ " ) ", "cast(change_request.change_request_review_date as " ~ dbt.type_timestamp() ~ " ) ", 'day') }} as change_request_days_created_to_reviewed,
        change_task.total_tasks as total_related_tasks,

    left join sys_user change_requestor

    left join sys_choice type_choice
        on change_request.change_request_type = type_choice.sys_choice_value
        and type_choice.element = 'type'
        and change_request.source_relation = type_choice.source_relation
    left join sys_choice phase_state_choice

        and change_request.change_request_phase = phase_state_choice.dependent_value

with change_request as (

),

),

change_request_enhanced as (

        change_request.change_request_start_date,
        change_request.change_requested_by_date,
        change_request.change_requested_by_link,
        change_request.change_requested_by_value,
        change_requestor.email as change_requestor_email,
        change_requestor.manager_value as change_requestor_manager_value,
        change_requestor.department_value as change_requestor_department_value,
        change_requestor.sys_user_name as change_requestor_name,
        change_requestor.sys_user_roles as change_requestor_roles,
        change_request.change_request_review_date,
        change_request.change_request_review_status,
        change_request.review_comments,
        change_request.change_plan,
        change_request.backout_plan,
        change_request.chg_model_link,
        change_request.chg_model_value,
        change_request.change_request_close_code,
        change_request.conflict_last_run,
        change_request.conflict_status,
        change_request.change_request_phase,
        change_request.change_request_phase_state,
        phase_state_choice.label as dv_change_request_phase_state_label,
        change_request.change_request_implementation_plan,
        change_request.change_request_justification,
        change_request.is_change_request_on_hold,
        change_request.change_request_on_hold_reason,
        change_request.on_hold_task,
        change_request.outside_maintenance_schedule,
        change_request.is_production_system,
        change_request.change_request_reason,
        change_request.change_request_risk,
        risk_choice.label as dv_change_request_risk_label,
        change_request.risk_impact_analysis,
        change_request.change_request_scope,
        change_request.change_request_test_plan,
        change_request.is_change_request_unauthorized,
        change_request.cab_date,
        change_request.cab_date_time,
        change_request.cab_delegate_link,
        change_request.cab_delegate_value,
        change_request.cab_recommendation,
        change_request.is_cab_required,
        change_request._fivetran_synced,
        
        ((cast(change_request.change_request_start_date as timestamp ) )::date - (cast(change_request.change_request_created_date as timestamp ) )::date)
     as change_request_days_created_to_start,
        
        ((cast(change_request.change_request_start_date as timestamp ) )::date - (cast(change_request.change_requested_by_date as timestamp ) )::date)
     as change_request_days_requested_by_to_start, 
        
        ((cast(change_request.change_request_review_date as timestamp ) )::date - (cast(change_request.change_request_created_date as timestamp ) )::date)
     as change_request_days_created_to_reviewed,
        change_task.total_tasks as total_related_tasks,
        change_request.source_relation

    from change_request
    left join change_task
        on change_request.change_request_id = change_task.change_request_value
        and change_request.source_relation = change_task.source_relation
    left join sys_user change_requestor
        on change_request.change_requested_by_value = change_requestor.sys_user_id
        and change_request.source_relation = change_requestor.source_relation
    left join sys_choice type_choice
        on change_request.change_request_type = type_choice.sys_choice_value
        and type_choice.element = 'type'
        and change_request.source_relation = type_choice.source_relation
    left join sys_choice phase_state_choice
        on change_request.change_request_phase_state = phase_state_choice.sys_choice_value
        and phase_state_choice.element = 'phase_state'
        and change_request.change_request_phase = phase_state_choice.dependent_value
        and change_request.source_relation = phase_state_choice.source_relation
    left join sys_choice risk_choice
        on change_request.change_request_risk = risk_choice.sys_choice_value
        and risk_choice.element = 'risk'
        and change_request.source_relation = risk_choice.source_relation
)

model.servicenow.servicenow__user_aggreg.description: Each record represents a user with their associated groups and roles. To prevent run failures caused by character limits, if there are more than 1000 distinct associated values, the field will output 'Too many fields to render' .

source_relation.name: source_relation
source_relation.description: Indicates the schema which the field originated. This is especially important when leveraging the union schema feature.

sys_user_group_ids.name: sys_user_group_ids
sys_user_group_ids.description: List of associated user group ids.

sys_user_role_ids.name: sys_user_role_ids
sys_user_role_ids.description: List of associated user roles ids.

sys_user_group_roles.name: sys_user_group_roles
sys_user_group_roles.description: List of associated user group roles.

count_distinct_sys_user_group_ids.name: count_distinct_sys_user_group_ids
count_distinct_sys_user_group_ids.description: The number of distinct sys_user_group_ids related to this user.

count_distinct_sys_user_role_ids.name: count_distinct_sys_user_role_ids
count_distinct_sys_user_role_ids.description: The number of distinct sys_user_role_ids related to this user.

count_distinct_sys_user_role_names.name: count_distinct_sys_user_role_names
count_distinct_sys_user_role_names.description: The number of distinct sys_user_role_names related to this user.

count_distinct_included_roles.name: count_distinct_included_roles
count_distinct_included_roles.description: The number of distinct included_roles related to this user.

count_distinct_sys_user_group_roles.name: count_distinct_sys_user_group_roles
count_distinct_sys_user_group_roles.description: The number of distinct sys_user_group_roles related to this user.

model.servicenow.servicenow__user_aggreg.raw_code:
{{ config(enabled=var('servicenow__using_roles', True)) }}

with sys_user as (
    
    select *
    from {{ ref('stg_servicenow__sys_user') }}
),

user_grmember as (

    select * 
    from {{ ref('stg_servicenow__sys_user_grmember') }}
),

user_has_role as (

    select * 
    from {{ ref('stg_servicenow__sys_user_has_role') }}
),

user_role as (

    select * 
    from {{ ref('stg_servicenow__sys_user_role') }}
),

user_group as (

    select * 
    from {{ ref('stg_servicenow__sys_user_group')}}
),

aggregate_counts as (

    select 
        sys_user.sys_user_id,
        sys_user.source_relation,
        count(distinct case when user_grmember.sys_user_group_id is not null and user_grmember.sys_user_group_id != '' then user_grmember.sys_user_group_id else null end) as count_distinct_sys_user_group_ids,
        count(distinct case when user_has_role.sys_user_role_id is not null and user_has_role.sys_user_role_id != '' then user_has_role.sys_user_role_id else null end) as count_distinct_sys_user_role_ids,
        count(distinct case when user_role.sys_user_role_name is not null and user_role.sys_user_role_name != '' then user_role.sys_user_role_name else null end) as count_distinct_sys_user_role_names,
        count(distinct case when user_role.includes_roles is not null and user_role.includes_roles != '' then user_role.includes_roles else null end) as count_distinct_included_roles,
        count(distinct case when user_group.sys_user_group_roles is not null and user_group.sys_user_group_roles != '' then user_group.sys_user_group_roles else null end) as count_distinct_sys_user_group_roles

    from sys_user
    left join user_grmember
        on sys_user.sys_user_id = user_grmember.sys_user_id
        and sys_user.source_relation = user_grmember.source_relation
    left join user_group
        on user_grmember.sys_user_group_id = user_group.sys_user_group_id
        and user_grmember.source_relation = user_group.source_relation
    left join user_has_role
        on sys_user.sys_user_id = user_has_role.sys_user_id
        and sys_user.source_relation = user_has_role.source_relation
    left join user_role
        on user_has_role.sys_user_role_id = user_role.sys_user_role_id
        and user_has_role.source_relation = user_role.source_relation

    {{ dbt_utils.group_by(2) }}
),

user_aggregates as (

    select
        sys_user.sys_user_id,
        sys_user.source_relation,
        count_distinct_sys_user_group_ids,
        case when
            aggregate_counts.count_distinct_sys_user_group_ids <= 5000 then {{ fivetran_utils.string_agg("distinct user_grmember.sys_user_group_id", "'\\n'") }}
            else 'Too many sys user group ids to render' 
        end as sys_user_group_ids,
        count_distinct_sys_user_role_ids,
        case when
            aggregate_counts.count_distinct_sys_user_role_ids <= 5000 then {{ fivetran_utils.string_agg("distinct user_has_role.sys_user_role_id", "'\\n'") }}
            else 'Too many sys user role ids to render' 
        end as sys_user_role_ids,
        count_distinct_sys_user_role_names,
        case when
            aggregate_counts.count_distinct_sys_user_role_names <= 5000 then {{ fivetran_utils.string_agg("distinct user_role.sys_user_role_name", "'\\n'") }}
            else 'Too many sys user role names to render' 
        end as sys_user_role_names,
        count_distinct_included_roles,
        case when
            aggregate_counts.count_distinct_included_roles <= 5000 then {{ fivetran_utils.string_agg("distinct user_role.includes_roles", "'\\n'") }}
            else 'Too many roles to render' 
        end as included_roles,
        count_distinct_sys_user_group_roles,
        case when
            aggregate_counts.count_distinct_sys_user_group_roles <= 5000 then {{ fivetran_utils.string_agg("distinct user_group.sys_user_group_roles", "'\\n'") }}
            else 'Too many sys user group roles to render' 
        end as sys_user_group_roles

    from sys_user
    left join aggregate_counts
        on sys_user.sys_user_id = aggregate_counts.sys_user_id
        and sys_user.source_relation = aggregate_counts.source_relation
    left join user_grmember
        on sys_user.sys_user_id = user_grmember.sys_user_id
        and sys_user.source_relation = user_grmember.source_relation
    left join user_group
        on user_grmember.sys_user_group_id = user_group.sys_user_group_id
        and user_grmember.source_relation = user_group.source_relation
    left join user_has_role
        on sys_user.sys_user_id = user_has_role.sys_user_id
        and sys_user.source_relation = user_has_role.source_relation
    left join user_role
        on user_has_role.sys_user_role_id = user_role.sys_user_role_id
        and user_has_role.source_relation = user_role.source_relation

    group by sys_user.sys_user_id, sys_user.source_relation, count_distinct_sys_user_group_ids, count_distinct_sys_user_role_ids, count_distinct_sys_user_role_names, count_distinct_included_roles, count_distinct_sys_user_group_roles
)

select * 
from user_aggregates
