model.servicenow.servicenow__problem_enh.name: servicenow__problem_enhanced
model.servicenow.servicenow__problem_enh.description: Each record represents a problem with additional information about users who have interacted with it, pertinent task data, and relevant timestamps.

problem_subcategory.name: problem_subcategory
problem_subcategory.description: The specific subcategory or classification of the issue, providing more detailed information about its nature.

problem_state.name: problem_state
problem_state.description: The current state or status of the problem or issue.

problem_created_at.name: problem_created_at
problem_created_at.description: Date and time when the problem record was initially created.

problem_updated_at.name: problem_updated_at
problem_updated_at.description: Date and time when the problem record was last updated.

problem_confirmed_at.name: problem_confirmed_at
problem_confirmed_at.description: The timestamp indicating when the problem was confirmed or acknowledged.

problem_confirmed_by_link.name: problem_confirmed_by_link
problem_confirmed_by_link.description: A link to the person or entity who confirmed or acknowledged the problem.

problem_confirmed_by_value.name: problem_confirmed_by_value
problem_confirmed_by_value.description: The name or identifier of the person or entity who confirmed or acknowledged the problem.

problem_fix_at.name: problem_fix_at
problem_fix_at.description: The timestamp indicating when the problem is scheduled or planned to be fixed.

problem_fix_by_link.name: problem_fix_by_link
problem_fix_by_link.description: A link to the person or entity responsible for fixing the problem.

problem_fix_by_value.name: problem_fix_by_value
problem_fix_by_value.description: The name or identifier of the person or entity responsible for fixing the problem.

problem_resolution_code.name: problem_resolution_code
problem_resolution_code.description: The code or identifier associated with the resolution of the problem.

problem_resolved_at.name: problem_resolved_at
problem_resolved_at.description: The timestamp indicating when the problem was resolved.

resolved_by_link.name: resolved_by_link
resolved_by_link.description: A link to the person or entity who resolved the issue.

problem_resolved_by_value.name: problem_resolved_by_value
problem_resolved_by_value.description: The name or identifier of the person or entity who resolved the problem.

problem_first_reported_by_task_link.name: problem_first_reported_by_task_link
problem_first_reported_by_task_link.description: A link to the task or activity that first reported the problem.

problem_first_reported_by_task_value.name: problem_first_reported_by_task_value
problem_first_reported_by_task_value.description: The name or identifier of the task or activity that first reported the problem.

fix_communicated_at.name: fix_communicated_at
fix_communicated_at.description: The timestamp indicating when the fix for the issue was communicated.

fix_communicated_by_link.name: fix_communicated_by_link
fix_communicated_by_link.description: A link to the person or entity who communicated the fix for the issue.

fix_communicated_by_value.name: fix_communicated_by_value
fix_communicated_by_value.description: The name or identifier of the person or entity who communicated the fix for the issue.

reopen_count.name: reopen_count
reopen_count.description: The count of how many times the issue has been reopened.

reopened_at.name: reopened_at
reopened_at.description: The timestamp indicating when the issue was last reopened.

reopened_by_link.name: reopened_by_link
reopened_by_link.description: A link to the person or entity who reopened the issue.

reopened_by_value.name: reopened_by_value
reopened_by_value.description: The name or identifier of the person or entity who reopened the issue.

cause_notes.name: cause_notes
cause_notes.description: Additional notes or details about the cause of a particular issue or incident.

duplicate_of_link.name: duplicate_of_link
duplicate_of_link.description: A link to the related issue that is identified as a duplicate of the current one.

duplicate_of_value.name: duplicate_of_value
duplicate_of_value.description: The name or identifier of the related issue that is identified as a duplicate.

problem_fix_notes.name: problem_fix_notes
problem_fix_notes.description: Additional notes or details related to the fix for the problem.

is_known_error.name: is_known_error
is_known_error.description: Indicates whether the issue is a known error with a documented resolution.

is_major_problem.name: is_major_problem
is_major_problem.description: Indicates whether the issue is categorized as a major problem.

problem_related_incidents.name: problem_related_incidents
problem_related_incidents.description: Number of incidents that are related to the current problem.

review_outcome.name: review_outcome
review_outcome.description: The outcome or result of the review process for the issue.

rfc_link.name: rfc_link
rfc_link.description: A link to the Request for Change (RFC) associated with the issue or incident.

rfc_value.name: rfc_value
rfc_value.description: The unique identifier or name associated with the Request for Change (RFC) linked to the issue.

workaround.name: workaround
workaround.description:
A description of a temporary or alternative solution that can be applied to address the issue before a permanent fix 
is implemented.

workaround_applied.name: workaround_applied

model.servicenow.servicenow__problem_enh.raw_code:
with problem as (
    select *
    from {{ ref('stg_servicenow__problem') }}
),

problem_task as (
    select
        problem_value,
        source_relation,
        count(problem_task_id) as total_tasks
    from {{ ref('stg_servicenow__problem_task') }}
    group by 1,2
),

sys_user as (
    select *
    from {{ ref('stg_servicenow__sys_user') }}
),

sys_choice as (
    select *
    from {{ ref('stg_servicenow__sys_choice') }}
    where sys_choice_name = 'problem'
),

problem_enhanced as (
    select
        problem.problem_id,
        problem.problem_subcategory,
        problem.problem_category,
        problem.problem_state,
        state_choice.label as dv_problem_state_label,
        problem.problem_created_at,
        problem.problem_updated_at,
        problem.problem_confirmed_at,
        problem.problem_confirmed_by_link,
        problem.problem_confirmed_by_value,
        problem_confirmer.email as problem_confirmer_email,
        problem_confirmer.manager_value as problem_confirmer_manager_value,
        problem_confirmer.department_value as problem_confirmer_department_value,
        problem_confirmer.sys_user_name as problem_confirmer_name,
        problem_confirmer.sys_user_roles as problem_confirmer_roles,
        problem.problem_fix_at,
        problem.problem_fix_by_link,
        problem.problem_fix_by_value,
        problem_fixer.email as problem_fixer_email,
        problem_fixer.manager_value as problem_fixer_manager_value,
        problem_fixer.department_value as problem_fixer_department_value,
        problem_fixer.sys_user_name as problem_fixer_name,
        problem_fixer.sys_user_roles as problem_fixer_roles,
        problem.problem_resolution_code,
        problem.problem_resolved_at,
        problem.resolved_by_link,
        problem.problem_resolved_by_value,
        problem_resolver.email as problem_resolver_email,
        problem_resolver.manager_value as problem_resolver_manager_value,
        problem_resolver.department_value as problem_resolver_department_value,
        problem_resolver.sys_user_name as problem_resolver_name,
        problem_resolver.sys_user_roles as problem_resolver_roles,
        problem.problem_first_reported_by_task_link,
        problem.problem_first_reported_by_task_value,
        problem.fix_communicated_at,
        problem.fix_communicated_by_link,
        problem.fix_communicated_by_value,
        problem_fix_communicator.email as problem_fix_communicator_email,
        problem_fix_communicator.manager_value as problem_fix_communicator_manager_value,
        problem_fix_communicator.department_value as problem_fix_communicator_department_value,
        problem_fix_communicator.sys_user_name as problem_fix_communicator_name,
        problem_fix_communicator.sys_user_roles as problem_fix_communicator_roles,
        problem.reopen_count,
        problem.reopened_at,
        problem.reopened_by_link,
        problem.reopened_by_value,
        problem_reopener.email as problem_reopener_email,
        problem_reopener.manager_value as problem_reopener_manager_value,
        problem_reopener.department_value as problem_reopener_department_value,
        problem_reopener.sys_user_name as problem_reopener_name,
        problem_reopener.sys_user_roles as problem_reopener_roles,
        problem.cause_notes,
        problem.duplicate_of_link,
        problem.duplicate_of_value,
        problem.problem_fix_notes,
        problem.is_known_error,
        problem.is_major_problem,
        problem.problem_related_incidents,
        problem.review_outcome,
        problem.rfc_link,
        problem.rfc_value,
        problem.workaround,
        problem.workaround_applied,
        problem.workaround_communicated_at,
        problem.workaround_communicated_by_link,
        problem.workaround_communicated_by_value,
        problem_workaround_communicator.email as problem_workaround_communicator_email,
        problem_workaround_communicator.manager_value as problem_workaround_communicator_manager_value,
        problem_workaround_communicator.department_value as problem_workaround_communicator_department_value,
        problem_workaround_communicator.sys_user_name as problem_workaround_communicator_name,
        problem_workaround_communicator.sys_user_roles as problem_workaround_communicator_roles,
        {{ dbt.datediff("cast(problem.problem_created_at as " ~ dbt.type_timestamp() ~  " ) ", "cast(problem.problem_fix_at as " ~ dbt.type_timestamp() ~ " ) ", 'minute') }} as problem_minutes_created_to_fix,
        {{ dbt.datediff("cast(problem.problem_created_at as " ~ dbt.type_timestamp() ~ " ) ", "cast(problem.problem_resolved_at as " ~ dbt.type_timestamp() ~ " ) ", 'minute') }} as problem_minutes_created_to_resolved,
        problem._fivetran_synced,
        problem_task.total_tasks as total_related_tasks,
        problem.source_relation
    from problem
    left join problem_task
        on problem.problem_id = problem_task.problem_value
        and problem.source_relation = problem_task.source_relation
    left join sys_user problem_confirmer
        on problem.problem_confirmed_by_value = problem_confirmer.sys_user_id
        and problem.source_relation = problem_confirmer.source_relation
    left join sys_user problem_fixer
        on problem.problem_fix_by_value = problem_fixer.sys_user_id
        and problem.source_relation = problem_fixer.source_relation
    left join sys_user problem_resolver
        on problem.problem_resolved_by_value = problem_resolver.sys_user_id
        and problem.source_relation = problem_resolver.source_relation
    left join sys_user problem_fix_communicator
        on problem.fix_communicated_by_value = problem_fix_communicator.sys_user_id
        and problem.source_relation = problem_fix_communicator.source_relation
    left join sys_user problem_reopener
        on problem.reopened_by_value = problem_reopener.sys_user_id
        and problem.source_relation = problem_reopener.source_relation
    left join sys_user problem_workaround_communicator
        on problem.workaround_communicated_by_value = problem_workaround_communicator.sys_user_id
        and problem.source_relation = problem_workaround_communicator.source_relation
    left join sys_choice state_choice
        on problem.problem_state = state_choice.sys_choice_value
        and state_choice.element = 'state'
        and problem.source_relation = state_choice.source_relation
)

select *
from problem_enhanced
model.servicenow.servicenow__problem_enh.compiled_code:
with problem as (
    select *
    from "postgres"."public_servicenow_dev"."stg_servicenow__problem"
),

problem_task as (
    select
        problem_value,
        source_relation,
        count(problem_task_id) as total_tasks
    from "postgres"."public_servicenow_dev"."stg_servicenow__problem_task"
    group by 1,2
),

sys_user as (
    select *
    from "postgres"."public_servicenow_dev"."stg_servicenow__sys_user"
),

sys_choice as (
    select *
    from "postgres"."public_servicenow_dev"."stg_servicenow__sys_choice"
    where sys_choice_name = 'problem'
),

problem_enhanced as (
    select
        problem.problem_id,
        problem.problem_subcategory,
        problem.problem_category,
        problem.problem_state,
        state_choice.label as dv_problem_state_label,
        problem.problem_created_at,
        problem.problem_updated_at,
        problem.problem_confirmed_at,
        problem.problem_confirmed_by_link,
        problem.problem_confirmed_by_value,
        problem_confirmer.email as problem_confirmer_email,
        problem_confirmer.manager_value as problem_confirmer_manager_value,
        problem_confirmer.department_value as problem_confirmer_department_value,
        problem_confirmer.sys_user_name as problem_confirmer_name,
        problem_confirmer.sys_user_roles as problem_confirmer_roles,
        problem.problem_fix_at,
        problem.problem_fix_by_link,
        problem.problem_fix_by_value,
        problem_fixer.email as problem_fixer_email,
        problem_fixer.manager_value as problem_fixer_manager_value,
        problem_fixer.department_value as problem_fixer_department_value,
        problem_fixer.sys_user_name as problem_fixer_name,
        problem_fixer.sys_user_roles as problem_fixer_roles,
        problem.problem_resolution_code,
        problem.problem_resolved_at,
        problem.resolved_by_link,
        problem.problem_resolved_by_value,
        problem_resolver.email as problem_resolver_email,
        problem_resolver.manager_value as problem_resolver_manager_value,
        problem_resolver.department_value as problem_resolver_department_value,
        problem_resolver.sys_user_name as problem_resolver_name,
        problem_resolver.sys_user_roles as problem_resolver_roles,
        problem.problem_first_reported_by_task_link,
        problem.problem_first_reported_by_task_value,
        problem.fix_communicated_at,
        problem.fix_communicated_by_link,
        problem.fix_communicated_by_value,
        problem_fix_communicator.email as problem_fix_communicator_email,
        problem_fix_communicator.manager_value as problem_fix_communicator_manager_value,
        problem_fix_communicator.department_value as problem_fix_communicator_department_value,
        problem_fix_communicator.sys_user_name as problem_fix_communicator_name,
        problem_fix_communicator.sys_user_roles as problem_fix_communicator_roles,
        problem.reopen_count,
        problem.reopened_at,
        problem.reopened_by_link,
        problem.reopened_by_value,
        problem_reopener.email as problem_reopener_email,
        problem_reopener.manager_value as problem_reopener_manager_value,
        problem_reopener.department_value as problem_reopener_department_value,
        problem_reopener.sys_user_name as problem_reopener_name,
        problem_reopener.sys_user_roles as problem_reopener_roles,
        problem.cause_notes,
        problem.duplicate_of_link,
        problem.duplicate_of_value,
        problem.problem_fix_notes,
        problem.is_known_error,
        problem.is_major_problem,
        problem.problem_related_incidents,
        problem.review_outcome,
        problem.rfc_link,
        problem.rfc_value,
        problem.workaround,
        problem.workaround_applied,
        problem.workaround_communicated_at,
        problem.workaround_communicated_by_link,
        problem.workaround_communicated_by_value,
        problem_workaround_communicator.email as problem_workaround_communicator_email,
        problem_workaround_communicator.manager_value as problem_workaround_communicator_manager_value,
        problem_workaround_communicator.department_value as problem_workaround_communicator_department_value,
        problem_workaround_communicator.sys_user_name as problem_workaround_communicator_name,
        problem_workaround_communicator.sys_user_roles as problem_workaround_communicator_roles,
        
        (
        (
        ((cast(problem.problem_fix_at as timestamp ) )::date - (cast(problem.problem_created_at as timestamp ) )::date)
     * 24 + date_part('hour', (cast(problem.problem_fix_at as timestamp ) )::timestamp) - date_part('hour', (cast(problem.problem_created_at as timestamp ) )::timestamp))
     * 60 + date_part('minute', (cast(problem.problem_fix_at as timestamp ) )::timestamp) - date_part('minute', (cast(problem.problem_created_at as timestamp ) )::timestamp))
     as problem_minutes_created_to_fix,
        
        (
        (
        ((cast(problem.problem_resolved_at as timestamp ) )::date - (cast(problem.problem_created_at as timestamp ) )::date)
     * 24 + date_part('hour', (cast(problem.problem_resolved_at as timestamp ) )::timestamp) - date_part('hour', (cast(problem.problem_created_at as timestamp ) )::timestamp))
     * 60 + date_part('minute', (cast(problem.problem_resolved_at as timestamp ) )::timestamp) - date_part('minute', (cast(problem.problem_created_at as timestamp ) )::timestamp))
     as problem_minutes_created_to_resolved,
        problem._fivetran_synced,
        problem_task.total_tasks as total_related_tasks,
        problem.source_relation
    from problem
    left join problem_task
        on problem.problem_id = problem_task.problem_value
        and problem.source_relation = problem_task.source_relation
    left join sys_user problem_confirmer
        on problem.problem_confirmed_by_value = problem_confirmer.sys_user_id
        and problem.source_relation = problem_confirmer.source_relation
    left join sys_user problem_fixer
        on problem.problem_fix_by_value = problem_fixer.sys_user_id
        and problem.source_relation = problem_fixer.source_relation
    left join sys_user problem_resolver
        on problem.problem_resolved_by_value = problem_resolver.sys_user_id
        and problem.source_relation = problem_resolver.source_relation
    left join sys_user problem_fix_communicator
        on problem.fix_communicated_by_value = problem_fix_communicator.sys_user_id
        and problem.source_relation = problem_fix_communicator.source_relation
    left join sys_user problem_reopener
        on problem.reopened_by_value = problem_reopener.sys_user_id
        and problem.source_relation = problem_reopener.source_relation
    left join sys_user problem_workaround_communicator
        on problem.workaround_communicated_by_value = problem_workaround_communicator.sys_user_id
        and problem.source_relation = problem_workaround_communicator.source_relation
    left join sys_choice state_choice
        on problem.problem_state = state_choice.sys_choice_value
        and state_choice.element = 'state'
        and problem.source_relation = state_choice.source_relation
)

model.servicenow.servicenow__incident_en.name: servicenow__incident_enhanced
model.servicenow.servicenow__incident_en.description: Each record represents an incident with additional information about users who have interacted with it and relevant timestamps.

incident_subcategory.name: incident_subcategory
incident_subcategory.description: The specific subcategory or classification of the record, providing more detailed information about its nature.

incident_severity.name: incident_severity
incident_severity.description: The level of impact or seriousness assigned to the issue or incident.

incident_state.name: incident_state
incident_state.description: The current state or status of the incident.

incident_created_at.name: incident_created_at
incident_created_at.description: Date and time when the incident record was initially created.

incident_updated_at.name: incident_updated_at
incident_updated_at.description: Date and time when the incident record was last updated.

reopened_by_link.name: reopened_by_link
reopened_by_link.description: A link to the person or entity who reopened the issue.

reopened_by_value.name: reopened_by_value
reopened_by_value.description: The name or identifier of the person or entity who reopened the issue.

reopener_email.name: reopener_email
reopener_email.description: Email address associated with the record.

reopener_manager_value.name: reopener_manager_value
reopener_manager_value.description: The name or identifier of the user's manager or supervisor.

reopener_department_value.name: reopener_department_value
reopener_department_value.description: Value representing the department associated with the system user.

reopener_name.name: reopener_name
reopener_name.description: The system username or identifier for the user.

reopener_roles.name: reopener_roles
reopener_roles.description: The roles assigned to the user in the system or organization.

incident_reopened_time.name: incident_reopened_time
incident_reopened_time.description: The timestamp indicating when the issue or incident was reopened after being previously resolved.

incident_resolved_at.name: incident_resolved_at
incident_resolved_at.description: The timestamp indicating when the issue was resolved.

resolved_by_link.name: resolved_by_link
resolved_by_link.description: A link to the person or entity who resolved the issue.

resolved_by_value.name: resolved_by_value
resolved_by_value.description: The name or identifier of the person or entity who resolved the issue.

resolver_email.name: resolver_email
resolver_email.description: Email address associated with the record.

resolver_manager_value.name: resolver_manager_value
resolver_manager_value.description: The name or identifier of the user's manager or supervisor.

resolver_department_value.name: resolver_department_value
resolver_department_value.description: Value representing the department associated with the system user.

resolver_name.name: resolver_name
resolver_name.description: The system username or identifier for the user.

resolver_roles.name: resolver_roles
resolver_roles.description: The roles assigned to the user in the system or organization.

business_impact.name: business_impact
business_impact.description: Information about the impact of the issue on business operations or services.

business_stc.name: business_stc
business_stc.description: The business service that is impacted by the issue or incident.

calendar_stc.name: calendar_stc
calendar_stc.description: The calendar or schedule associated with the business service impacted by the issue.

caller_id_link.name: caller_id_link
caller_id_link.description: A link to the person or entity identified as the caller or reporter of the issue or incident.

caller_id_value.name: caller_id_value
caller_id_value.description: The name or identifier of the person or entity identified as the caller or reporter of the issue.

caller_email.name: caller_email
caller_email.description: Email address associated with the record.

caller_manager_value.name: caller_manager_value
caller_manager_value.description: The name or identifier of the user's manager or supervisor.

caller_department_value.name: caller_department_value
caller_department_value.description: Value representing the department associated with the system user.

caller_name.name: caller_name
caller_name.description: The system username or identifier for the user.

caller_roles.name: caller_roles
caller_roles.description: The roles assigned to the user in the system or organization.

incident_cause.name: incident_cause
incident_cause.description: A description or explanation of the root cause of the issue or incident.

caused_by_link.name: caused_by_link
caused_by_link.description: A link to the record or entity that caused or triggered the issue or incident.

caused_by_value.name: caused_by_value
caused_by_value.description: The name or identifier of the record or entity that caused or triggered the issue or incident.

child_incidents.name: child_incidents
child_incidents.description: The number of incidents that are identified as child incidents linked to the current incident.

close_code.name: close_code
close_code.description: The code or identifier associated with the closure or resolution.

hold_reason.name: hold_reason
hold_reason.description: The reason or rationale for placing the issue or incident on hold.

notify.name: notify
notify.description: Indicates whether notifications or alerts have been configured for the issue or incident.

origin_id_link.name: origin_id_link
origin_id_link.description: A link to the original or source record from which the current record originated.

origin_id_value.name: origin_id_value
origin_id_value.description: The unique identifier or name associated with the original or source record linked to the current record.

parent_incident_link.name: parent_incident_link
parent_incident_link.description: A link to the parent incident record, indicating the incident from which the current incident is derived or related.

parent_incident_value.name: parent_incident_value
parent_incident_value.description: The unique identifier or name associated with the parent incident record linked to the current incident.

problem_id_link.name: problem_id_link
problem_id_link.description: A link to the problem record associated with the current issue or incident.

problem_id_value.name: problem_id_value
problem_id_value.description: The unique identifier or name associated with the problem record linked to the current issue or incident.

reopen_count.name: reopen_count
reopen_count.description: The count of how many times the issue has been reopened.

rfc_link.name: rfc_link
rfc_link.description: A link to the Request for Change (RFC) associated with the issue or incident.

rfc_value.name: rfc_value
rfc_value.description: The unique identifier or name associated with the Request for Change (RFC) linked to the issue.

incident_minutes_created_to_resolved.name: incident_minutes_created_to_resolved
incident_minutes_created_to_resolved.description: Minutes elapsed from when incident was created to resolved.

_fivetran_synced.name: _fivetran_synced
_fivetran_synced.description: Indicates whether the task record has been synchronized by the Fivetran connector.

source_relation.name: source_relation

model.servicenow.servicenow__incident_en.raw_code:
with incident as (
    select *
    from {{ ref('stg_servicenow__incident') }}
),

sys_user as (
    select *
    from {{ ref('stg_servicenow__sys_user') }}
),

sys_choice as (
    select *
    from {{ ref('stg_servicenow__sys_choice') }}
    where sys_choice_name = 'incident'
),

incident_enhanced as (
    select
        incident.incident_id,
        incident.incident_category,
        category_choice.label as dv_incident_category_label,
        incident.incident_subcategory,
        subcategory_choice.label as dv_incident_subcategory_label,
        incident.incident_severity,
        severity_choice.label as dv_incident_severity_label,
        incident.incident_state,
        state_choice.label as dv_incident_state_label,
        incident.incident_created_at,
        incident.incident_updated_at,
        incident.reopened_by_link,
        incident.reopened_by_value,
        reopener.email as reopener_email,
        reopener.manager_value as reopener_manager_value,
        reopener.department_value as reopener_department_value,
        reopener.sys_user_name as reopener_name,
        reopener.sys_user_roles as reopener_roles,
        incident.incident_reopened_time,
        incident.incident_resolved_at,
        incident.resolved_by_link,
        incident.resolved_by_value,
        resolver.email as resolver_email,
        resolver.manager_value as resolver_manager_value,
        resolver.department_value as resolver_department_value,
        resolver.sys_user_name as resolver_name,
        resolver.sys_user_roles as resolver_roles,
        incident.business_impact,
        business_impact_choice.label as dv_business_impact_label,
        incident.business_stc,
        incident.calendar_stc,
        incident.caller_id_link,
        incident.caller_id_value,
        caller_info.email as caller_email,
        caller_info.manager_value as caller_manager_value,
        caller_info.department_value as caller_department_value,
        caller_info.sys_user_name as caller_name,
        caller_info.sys_user_roles as caller_roles,
        incident.incident_cause,
        incident.caused_by_link,
        incident.caused_by_value,
        coalesce(incident.child_incidents,0) as child_incidents,
        incident.close_code,
        incident.hold_reason,
        incident.notify,
        incident.origin_id_link,
        incident.origin_id_value,
        incident.parent_incident_link,
        incident.parent_incident_value,
        incident.problem_id_link,
        incident.problem_id_value,
        incident.reopen_count,
        incident.rfc_link,
        incident.rfc_value,
        {{ dbt.datediff("cast(incident_created_at as " ~ dbt.type_timestamp() ~ " ) ", "cast(incident_resolved_at as " ~ dbt.type_timestamp() ~ " ) ", 'minute') }} as incident_minutes_created_to_resolved,
        incident._fivetran_synced,
        incident.source_relation
    from incident
    left join sys_user reopener
        on incident.reopened_by_value = reopener.sys_user_id
        and incident.source_relation = reopener.source_relation
    left join sys_user resolver
        on incident.resolved_by_value = resolver.sys_user_id
        and incident.source_relation = resolver.source_relation
    left join sys_user caller_info
        on incident.caller_id_value = caller_info.sys_user_id
        and incident.source_relation = caller_info.source_relation
    left join sys_choice category_choice
        on incident.incident_category = category_choice.sys_choice_value
        and category_choice.element = 'category'
        and incident.source_relation = category_choice.source_relation
    left join sys_choice subcategory_choice
        on incident.incident_subcategory = subcategory_choice.sys_choice_value
        and subcategory_choice.element = 'subcategory'
        and incident.incident_category = subcategory_choice.dependent_value 
        and incident.source_relation = subcategory_choice.source_relation
    left join sys_choice state_choice
        on incident.incident_state = state_choice.sys_choice_value
        and state_choice.element = 'state'
        and incident.source_relation = state_choice.source_relation
    left join sys_choice business_impact_choice
        on incident.business_impact = business_impact_choice.sys_choice_value
        and business_impact_choice.element = 'business_impact'
        and incident.source_relation = business_impact_choice.source_relation
    left join sys_choice severity_choice
        on incident.incident_severity = severity_choice.sys_choice_value
        and severity_choice.element = 'severity'
        and incident.source_relation = severity_choice.source_relation
)

select *
from incident_enhanced

    select * 
    from {{ ref('stg_servicenow__sys_user_group_base') }}
),

fields as (

        {{
            fivetran_utils.fill_staging_columns(
                source_columns=adapter.get_columns_in_relation(ref('stg_servicenow__sys_user_group_base')),
                staging_columns=get_sys_user_group_columns()
            )
        }}
        {{ fivetran_utils.source_relation(
            union_schema_variable='servicenow_union_schemas', 
            union_database_variable='servicenow_union_databases') 
        }}
    from base
),

final as (
    
    select
        source_relation, 
        cast(sys_id as {{ dbt.type_string() }}) as sys_user_group_id,
        cast(sys_created_on as {{ dbt.type_timestamp() }}) as sys_user_group_created_at,

        _fivetran_deleted,

        active as is_active,
        cost_center_link,
        cast(cost_center_value as {{ dbt.type_string() }}) as cost_center_value,
        default_assignee_link,
        cast(default_assignee_value as {{ dbt.type_string() }}) as default_assignee_value,
        description as sys_user_group_description,
        email as sys_user_group_email,
        exclude_manager,
        include_members,
        manager_link,
        cast(manager_value as {{ dbt.type_string() }}) as manager_value,
        name as sys_user_group_name,
        parent_link,
        cast(parent_value as {{ dbt.type_string() }}) as parent_value,
        roles as sys_user_group_roles,
        source,
        sys_created_by,
        sys_mod_count,
        sys_updated_by,
        type
    from fields
    where not coalesce(_fivetran_deleted, false)
)

select *
from final

model.servicenow.stg_servicenow__task.name: stg_servicenow__task
model.servicenow.stg_servicenow__task.description: Staging table containing all tasks related information. A task represents a unit of work that needs to be accomplished or tracked within the ServiceNow system. It can be related to various processes, such as incident resolution, change management, or other workflows.

source_relation.name: source_relation
source_relation.description: Indicates the schema which the field originated. This is especially important when leveraging the union schema feature.

is_task_active.description: Flag indicating whether the task is currently active or completed.

activity_due.description: The due date or time for completing the activity associated with the task.

additional_assignee_list.name: additional_assignee_list
additional_assignee_list.description: List of additional users or assignees associated with the task.

approval.description: Information related to the approval status and process for the task.

approval_history.description: History of approvals associated with the task.

approval_set.name: approval_set
approval_set.description: Set of approvals linked to the task.

assigned_to_link.description: Link to the user or group assigned to the task.

assigned_to_value.description: Value representing the user or group assigned to the task.

assignment_group_link.description: Link to the assignment group associated with the task.

assignment_group_value.name: assignment_group_value
assignment_group_value.description: Value representing the assignment group associated with the task.

business_duration.description: The duration of the task in terms of business time. Represented as an epoch timestamp, or the number of seconds from midnight, January 1, 1970.

business_duration_sec.name: business_duration_sec
business_duration_sec.description: The duration of the task in terms of business time (in seconds).

business_service_link.description: Link to the business service associated with the task.

business_service_value.name: business_service_value
business_service_value.description: Value representing the business service associated with the task.

calendar_duration.name: calendar_duration
calendar_duration.description: The duration of the task in terms of calendar time. Represented as an epoch timestamp, or the number of seconds from midnight, January 1, 1970.

calendar_duration_sec.name: calendar_duration_sec
calendar_duration_sec.description: The duration of the task in terms of calendar time (in seconds).

close_notes.name: close_notes
close_notes.description: Additional notes or comments recorded upon task closure.

task_closed_at.name: task_closed_at
task_closed_at.description: Date and time when the task was closed or completed.

closed_by_link.name: closed_by_link
closed_by_link.description: Link to the user who closed or completed the task.

closed_by_value.name: closed_by_value
closed_by_value.description: Value representing the user who closed or completed the task.

cmdb_ci_link.description: Link to the configuration item (CI) associated with the record in the Configuration Management Database (CMDB).

cmdb_ci_value.name: cmdb_ci_value
cmdb_ci_value.description: Value representing the configuration item (CI) associated with the record.

expected_start.description: The expected start date or time for the task.

task_follow_up_at.name: task_follow_up_at
task_follow_up_at.description: Timestamp of when follow up was applied to the task.

group_list.description: List of groups associated with the task.

is_made_sla.description: Indicates whether the task was completed within the agreed-upon Service Level Agreement (SLA).

task_number.name: task_number
task_number.description: Unique identifier or reference number assigned to the task.

task_opened_at.name: task_opened_at
task_opened_at.description: Date and time when the task was initially opened.

opened_by_link.name: opened_by_link
opened_by_link.description: Link to the user who initially opened the task.

opened_by_value.name: opened_by_value
opened_by_value.description: Value representing the user who initially opened the task.

task_order.name: task_order
task_order.description: Order or sequence number associated with the task.

parent_link.name: parent_link
parent_link.description: Link to the parent task or record associated with the task.

parent_value.name: parent_value
parent_value.description: Value representing the parent task or record associated with the task.

priority.name: priority
priority.description: Priority level assigned to the task. The priority field is automatically calculated based on the values of impact and urgency. This determines the sequence in which the record should be resolved.

reassignment_count.name: reassignment_count
reassignment_count.description: Count of how many times the task has been reassigned.

rejection_goto_link.name: rejection_goto_link
rejection_goto_link.description: Link to the record or step to be followed in case of task rejection.

rejection_goto_value.name: rejection_goto_value
rejection_goto_value.description: Value representing the record or step to be followed in case of task rejection.

route_reason.name: route_reason
route_reason.description: Reason or criteria for routing the task to a particular user or group.

service_offering_link.name: service_offering_link
service_offering_link.description: Link to the service offering associated with the record.

service_offering_value.name: service_offering_value
service_offering_value.description: Value representing the service offering associated with the record.

short_description.name: short_description
short_description.description: Brief or concise summary of the record.

sla_due.name: sla_due
sla_due.description: Date and time by which the record is expected to meet the Service Level Agreement (SLA).

task_state.name: task_state
task_state.description: Current state or status of the task (e.g., in progress, on hold, closed).

sys_class_name.name: sys_class_name
sys_class_name.description: Name of the table in which the record is stored.

sys_created_by.name: sys_created_by
sys_created_by.description: User who initially created the record.

task_created_at.name: task_created_at
task_created_at.description: Date and time when the task record was initially created.

sys_domain_link.name: sys_domain_link
sys_domain_link.description: Link to the system domain associated with the record.

sys_domain_path.name: sys_domain_path
sys_domain_path.description: Path of the system domain associated with the record.

sys_domain_value.name: sys_domain_value
sys_domain_value.description: Value representing the system domain associated with the record.

sys_mod_count.name: sys_mod_count
sys_mod_count.description: Number of times the record has been modified.

sys_updated_by.name: sys_updated_by
sys_updated_by.description: User who last updated or modified the record.

task_updated_at.name: task_updated_at
task_updated_at.description: Date and time when the task record was last updated.

task_effective_number.name: task_effective_number
task_effective_number.description: Effective number or identifier associated with the task.

universal_request_link.name: universal_request_link
universal_request_link.description: Link to the universal request associated with the task.

universal_request_value.name: universal_request_value
universal_request_value.description: Value representing the universal request associated with the task.

upon_approval.name: upon_approval
upon_approval.description: Actions or steps to be taken upon the approval of the task.

upon_reject.name: upon_reject
upon_reject.description: Actions or steps to be taken upon the rejection of the task.

urgency.name: urgency
urgency.description: Level of urgency associated with the record. Speed at which the business expects the record to be resolved.

watch_list.name: watch_list
watch_list.description: List of users or groups who are monitoring or "watching" the task.

wf_activity_link.name: wf_activity_link
wf_activity_link.description: Link to the workflow activity associated with the task.

wf_activity_value.name: wf_activity_value
wf_activity_value.description: Value representing the workflow activity associated with the task.

work_end.name: work_end
work_end.description: Date and time when the work on the task is scheduled to end.

work_notes.name: work_notes
work_notes.description: Notes or comments recorded during the work on the task.

work_notes_list.name: work_notes_list
work_notes_list.description: List of work notes recorded during the task's lifecycle.

work_start.name: work_start
work_start.description: Date and time when the work on the task is scheduled to start.

model.servicenow.stg_servicenow__task.raw_code:
with base as (
    select * 
    from {{ ref('stg_servicenow__task_base') }}
),

fields as (
    select
        {{
            fivetran_utils.fill_staging_columns(
                source_columns=adapter.get_columns_in_relation(ref('stg_servicenow__task_base')),
                staging_columns=get_task_columns()
            )
        }}
        {{ fivetran_utils.source_relation(
            union_schema_variable='servicenow_union_schemas', 
            union_database_variable='servicenow_union_databases') 
        }}
    from base
),

final as (
    select 
        source_relation,
        cast(sys_id as {{ dbt.type_string() }}) as task_id,
        cast(sys_created_on as {{ dbt.type_timestamp() }}) as task_created_at,
        cast(sys_updated_on as {{ dbt.type_timestamp() }}) as task_updated_at,
        _fivetran_deleted,
        _fivetran_synced,
        cast(active as {{ dbt.type_boolean() }}) as is_task_active,
        activity_due,
        additional_assignee_list,
        approval,
        approval_history,
        approval_set,
        assigned_to_link,
        cast(assigned_to_value as {{ dbt.type_string() }}) as assigned_to_value,
        assignment_group_link,
        cast(assignment_group_value as {{ dbt.type_string() }}) as assignment_group_value,
        business_duration,
{{ dbt.datediff(
      "cast('1970-01-01' as " ~ dbt.type_timestamp() ~ ")",
      "business_duration",
      "second"
) }} as business_duration_sec,
        business_service_link,
        cast(business_service_value as {{ dbt.type_string() }}) as business_service_value,
        calendar_duration,
  {{ dbt.datediff(
      "cast('1970-01-01' as " ~ dbt.type_timestamp() ~ ")",
      "calendar_duration",
      "second"
  ) }} as calendar_duration_sec,
        close_notes,
        cast(closed_at as {{ dbt.type_timestamp() }}) as task_closed_at,
        closed_by_link,
        cast(closed_by_value as {{ dbt.type_string() }}) as closed_by_value,
        cmdb_ci_link,
        cast(cmdb_ci_value as {{ dbt.type_string() }}) as cmdb_ci_value,
        comments,
        comments_and_work_notes,
        company_link,
        cast(company_value as {{ dbt.type_string() }}) as company_value,
        contact_type,
        contract_link,
        cast(contract_value as {{ dbt.type_string() }}) as contract_value,
        correlation_display,
        correlation_id,
        delivery_plan_link,
        cast(delivery_plan_value as {{ dbt.type_string() }}) as delivery_plan_value,
        delivery_task_link,
        cast(delivery_task_value as {{ dbt.type_string() }}) as delivery_task_value,
        description as task_description,
        cast ({{ dbt.date_trunc('day', 'due_date') }} as date) as task_due_date_at,
        escalation,
        expected_start,
        follow_up as task_follow_up_at,
        group_list,
        cast(impact as {{ dbt.type_string() }}) as impact,
        knowledge,
        location_link,
        cast(location_value as {{ dbt.type_string() }}) as location_value,
        cast(made_sla as {{ dbt.type_boolean() }}) as is_made_sla,
        number as task_number,
        cast(opened_at as {{ dbt.type_timestamp() }}) as task_opened_at,
        opened_by_link,
        cast(opened_by_value as {{ dbt.type_string() }}) as opened_by_value,
        task_order, -- Renamed within the get_task_columns() macro.
        parent_link,
        cast(parent_value as {{ dbt.type_string() }}) as parent_value,
        cast(priority as {{ dbt.type_string() }}) as priority,
        reassignment_count,
        rejection_goto_link,
        cast(rejection_goto_value as {{ dbt.type_string() }}) as rejection_goto_value,
        route_reason,
        service_offering_link,
        cast(service_offering_value as {{ dbt.type_string() }}) as service_offering_value,
        short_description,
        sla_due,
        cast(state as {{ dbt.type_string() }}) as task_state,
        sys_class_name,
        sys_created_by,
        sys_domain_link,
        sys_domain_path,
        cast(sys_domain_value as {{ dbt.type_string() }}) as sys_domain_value,
        sys_mod_count,
        sys_updated_by,
        task_effective_number,
        universal_request_link,
        cast(universal_request_value as {{ dbt.type_string() }}) as universal_request_value,
        upon_approval,
        upon_reject,
        cast(urgency as {{ dbt.type_string() }}) as urgency,
        watch_list,
        wf_activity_link,
        cast(wf_activity_value as {{ dbt.type_string() }}) as wf_activity_value,
        work_end,
        work_notes,
        work_notes_list,
        work_start
    from fields
    where not coalesce(_fivetran_deleted, false)
)

select *
from final

, cast('' as TEXT) as source_relation



    from base
),

final as (
    select 
        source_relation,
        cast(sys_id as TEXT) as task_id,
        cast(sys_created_on as timestamp) as task_created_at,
        cast(sys_updated_on as timestamp) as task_updated_at,
        _fivetran_deleted,
        _fivetran_synced,
        cast(active as boolean) as is_task_active,
        activity_due,
        additional_assignee_list,
        approval,
        approval_history,
        approval_set,
        assigned_to_link,
        cast(assigned_to_value as TEXT) as assigned_to_value,
        assignment_group_link,
        cast(assignment_group_value as TEXT) as assignment_group_value,
        business_duration,

        (
        (
        (
        ((business_duration)::date - (cast('1970-01-01' as timestamp))::date)
     * 24 + date_part('hour', (business_duration)::timestamp) - date_part('hour', (cast('1970-01-01' as timestamp))::timestamp))
     * 60 + date_part('minute', (business_duration)::timestamp) - date_part('minute', (cast('1970-01-01' as timestamp))::timestamp))
     * 60 + floor(date_part('second', (business_duration)::timestamp)) - floor(date_part('second', (cast('1970-01-01' as timestamp))::timestamp)))
     as business_duration_sec,
        business_service_link,
        cast(business_service_value as TEXT) as business_service_value,
        calendar_duration,
  
        (
        (
        (
        ((calendar_duration)::date - (cast('1970-01-01' as timestamp))::date)
     * 24 + date_part('hour', (calendar_duration)::timestamp) - date_part('hour', (cast('1970-01-01' as timestamp))::timestamp))
     * 60 + date_part('minute', (calendar_duration)::timestamp) - date_part('minute', (cast('1970-01-01' as timestamp))::timestamp))
     * 60 + floor(date_part('second', (calendar_duration)::timestamp)) - floor(date_part('second', (cast('1970-01-01' as timestamp))::timestamp)))
     as calendar_duration_sec,
        close_notes,
        cast(closed_at as timestamp) as task_closed_at,
        closed_by_link,
        cast(closed_by_value as TEXT) as closed_by_value,
        cmdb_ci_link,
        cast(cmdb_ci_value as TEXT) as cmdb_ci_value,
        comments,
        comments_and_work_notes,
        company_link,
        cast(company_value as TEXT) as company_value,
        contact_type,
        contract_link,
        cast(contract_value as TEXT) as contract_value,
        correlation_display,
        correlation_id,
        delivery_plan_link,
        cast(delivery_plan_value as TEXT) as delivery_plan_value,
        delivery_task_link,
        cast(delivery_task_value as TEXT) as delivery_task_value,
        description as task_description,
        cast (date_trunc('day', due_date) as date) as task_due_date_at,
        escalation,
        expected_start,
        follow_up as task_follow_up_at,
        group_list,
        cast(impact as TEXT) as impact,
        knowledge,
        location_link,
        cast(location_value as TEXT) as location_value,
        cast(made_sla as boolean) as is_made_sla,
        number as task_number,
        cast(opened_at as timestamp) as task_opened_at,
        opened_by_link,
        cast(opened_by_value as TEXT) as opened_by_value,
        task_order, -- Renamed within the get_task_columns() macro.
        parent_link,
        cast(parent_value as TEXT) as parent_value,
        cast(priority as TEXT) as priority,
        reassignment_count,
        rejection_goto_link,
        cast(rejection_goto_value as TEXT) as rejection_goto_value,
        route_reason,
        service_offering_link,
        cast(service_offering_value as TEXT) as service_offering_value,
        short_description,
        sla_due,
        cast(state as TEXT) as task_state,
        sys_class_name,
        sys_created_by,
        sys_domain_link,
        sys_domain_path,
        cast(sys_domain_value as TEXT) as sys_domain_value,
        sys_mod_count,
        sys_updated_by,
        task_effective_number,
        universal_request_link,
        cast(universal_request_value as TEXT) as universal_request_value,
        upon_approval,
        upon_reject,
        cast(urgency as TEXT) as urgency,
        watch_list,
        wf_activity_link,
        cast(wf_activity_value as TEXT) as wf_activity_value,
        work_end,
        work_notes,
        work_notes_list,
        work_start
    from fields
    where not coalesce(_fivetran_deleted, false)
)

model.servicenow.stg_servicenow__inciden.name: stg_servicenow__incident
model.servicenow.stg_servicenow__inciden.description: Staging table containing information related to incidents.

source_relation.name: source_relation
source_relation.description: Indicates the schema which the field originated. This is especially important when leveraging the union schema feature.

_fivetran_synced.name: _fivetran_synced
_fivetran_synced.description: Indicates whether the task record has been synchronized by the Fivetran connector.

business_impact.name: business_impact
business_impact.description: Information about the impact of the issue on business operations or services.

business_stc.name: business_stc
business_stc.description: The business service that is impacted by the issue or incident.

calendar_stc.name: calendar_stc
calendar_stc.description: The calendar or schedule associated with the business service impacted by the issue.

caller_id_link.name: caller_id_link
caller_id_link.description: A link to the person or entity identified as the caller or reporter of the issue or incident.

caller_id_value.name: caller_id_value
caller_id_value.description: The name or identifier of the person or entity identified as the caller or reporter of the issue.

incident_cause.name: incident_cause
incident_cause.description: A description or explanation of the root cause of the issue or incident.

caused_by_link.name: caused_by_link
caused_by_link.description: A link to the record or entity that caused or triggered the issue or incident.

caused_by_value.name: caused_by_value
caused_by_value.description: The name or identifier of the record or entity that caused or triggered the issue or incident.

child_incidents.name: child_incidents
child_incidents.description: The number of incidents that are identified as child incidents linked to the current incident.

close_code.name: close_code
close_code.description: The code or identifier associated with the closure or resolution.

hold_reason.name: hold_reason
hold_reason.description: The reason or rationale for placing the issue or incident on hold.

incident_state.name: incident_state
incident_state.description: The current state or status of the incident.

notify.name: notify
notify.description: Indicates whether notifications or alerts have been configured for the issue or incident.

origin_id_link.name: origin_id_link
origin_id_link.description: A link to the original or source record from which the current record originated.

origin_id_value.name: origin_id_value
origin_id_value.description: The unique identifier or name associated with the original or source record linked to the current record.

parent_incident_link.name: parent_incident_link
parent_incident_link.description: A link to the parent incident record, indicating the incident from which the current incident is derived or related.

parent_incident_value.name: parent_incident_value
parent_incident_value.description: The unique identifier or name associated with the parent incident record linked to the current incident.

problem_id_link.name: problem_id_link
problem_id_link.description: A link to the problem record associated with the current issue or incident.

problem_id_value.name: problem_id_value
problem_id_value.description: The unique identifier or name associated with the problem record linked to the current issue or incident.

reopen_count.name: reopen_count
reopen_count.description: The count of how many times the issue has been reopened.

reopened_by_link.name: reopened_by_link
reopened_by_link.description: A link to the person or entity who reopened the issue.

reopened_by_value.name: reopened_by_value
reopened_by_value.description: The name or identifier of the person or entity who reopened the issue.

incident_reopened_time.name: incident_reopened_time

incident_resolved_at.name: incident_resolved_at

resolved_by_value.name: resolved_by_value
resolved_by_value.description: The name or identifier of the person or entity who resolved the issue.

rfc_link.name: rfc_link

rfc_value.name: rfc_value

model.servicenow.stg_servicenow__problem.description: Staging table containing all problem information.

source_relation.name: source_relation
source_relation.description: Indicates the schema which the field originated. This is especially important when leveraging the union schema feature.

_fivetran_synced.name: _fivetran_synced
_fivetran_synced.description: Indicates whether the task record has been synchronized by the Fivetran connector.

cause_notes.name: cause_notes
cause_notes.description: Additional notes or details about the cause of a particular issue or incident.

problem_confirmed_at.name: problem_confirmed_at
problem_confirmed_at.description: The timestamp indicating when the problem was confirmed or acknowledged.

problem_confirmed_by_link.name: problem_confirmed_by_link
problem_confirmed_by_link.description: A link to the person or entity who confirmed or acknowledged the problem.

problem_confirmed_by_value.name: problem_confirmed_by_value
problem_confirmed_by_value.description: The name or identifier of the person or entity who confirmed or acknowledged the problem.

duplicate_of_link.name: duplicate_of_link
duplicate_of_link.description: A link to the related issue that is identified as a duplicate of the current one.

duplicate_of_value.name: duplicate_of_value
duplicate_of_value.description: The name or identifier of the related issue that is identified as a duplicate.

problem_first_reported_by_task_link.description: A link to the task or activity that first reported the problem.

problem_first_reported_by_task_value.name: problem_first_reported_by_task_value
problem_first_reported_by_task_value.description: The name or identifier of the task or activity that first reported the problem.

problem_fix_at.description: The timestamp indicating when the problem is scheduled or planned to be fixed.

problem_fix_by_link.name: problem_fix_by_link
problem_fix_by_link.description: A link to the person or entity responsible for fixing the problem.

problem_fix_by_value.name: problem_fix_by_value
problem_fix_by_value.description: The name or identifier of the person or entity responsible for fixing the problem.

fix_communicated_by_link.description: A link to the person or entity who communicated the fix for the issue.

fix_communicated_by_value.name: fix_communicated_by_value
fix_communicated_by_value.description: The name or identifier of the person or entity who communicated the fix for the issue.

problem_fix_notes.name: problem_fix_notes
problem_fix_notes.description: Additional notes or details related to the fix for the problem.

is_known_error.description: Indicates whether the issue is a known error with a documented resolution.

is_major_problem.name: is_major_problem
is_major_problem.description: Indicates whether the issue is categorized as a major problem.

problem_state.name: problem_state
problem_state.description: The current state or status of the problem or issue.

problem_related_incidents.name: problem_related_incidents
problem_related_incidents.description: Number of incidents that are related to the current problem.

reopened_at.name: reopened_at
reopened_at.description: The timestamp indicating when the issue was last reopened.

reopened_by_link.name: reopened_by_link
reopened_by_link.description: A link to the person or entity who reopened the issue.

reopened_by_value.name: reopened_by_value

problem_resolved_by_value.name: problem_resolved_by_value
problem_resolved_by_value.description: The name or identifier of the person or entity who resolved the problem.

review_outcome.name: review_outcome
review_outcome.description: The outcome or result of the review process for the issue.

rfc_link.name: rfc_link
rfc_link.description: A link to the Request for Change (RFC) associated with the issue or incident.

rfc_value.name: rfc_value
rfc_value.description: The unique identifier or name associated with the Request for Change (RFC) linked to the issue.

problem_updated_at.name: problem_updated_at

workaround.name: workaround
workaround.description:
A description of a temporary or alternative solution that can be applied to address the issue before a permanent fix 
is implemented.

workaround_applied.name: workaround_applied

workaround_communicated_at.name: workaround_communicated_at
workaround_communicated_at.description: The timestamp indicating when the workaround for the issue was communicated.

workaround_communicated_by_link.name: workaround_communicated_by_link

workaround_communicated_by_value.name: workaround_communicated_by_value
workaround_communicated_by_value.description: The name or identifier of the person or entity who communicated the workaround for the issue.

model.servicenow.stg_servicenow__sys_use.name: stg_servicenow__sys_user_role
model.servicenow.stg_servicenow__sys_use.description: Staging table containing information about roles that can belong to a user. When a role is added to a user, a new record is created here. A user’s role can be directly granted, inherited from other roles, or inherited from groups.

sys_user_role_name.name: sys_user_role_name
sys_user_role_name.description: The full name of the record.

_fivetran_synced.name: _fivetran_synced
_fivetran_synced.description: Indicates whether the task record has been synchronized by the Fivetran connector.

assignable_by_link.name: assignable_by_link
assignable_by_link.description: The link to the entity that can assign this role.

assignable_by_value.name: assignable_by_value
assignable_by_value.description: The value of the entity that can assign this role.

can_delegate.name: can_delegate
can_delegate.description: Boolean of whether this role can delegate.

sys_user_role_description.name: sys_user_role_description
sys_user_role_description.description: Detailed description or information about the record.

is_elevated_privilege.name: is_elevated_privilege
is_elevated_privilege.description: Boolean of whether this role is an elevated privilege.

is_grantable.name: is_grantable
is_grantable.description: Boolean of whether this role is grantable.

includes_roles.name: includes_roles
includes_roles.description: The roles included in this record.

requires_subscription.name: requires_subscription
requires_subscription.description: If this role requires a subscription.

scoped_admin.name: scoped_admin
scoped_admin.description: Boolean of whether the role was scoped administration.

sys_user_role_created_at.name: sys_user_role_created_at
sys_user_role_created_at.description: Date and time when the record was initially created.

sys_user_role_updated_at.name: sys_user_role_updated_at
sys_user_role_updated_at.description: Date and time when the record was last updated.

source_relation.name: source_relation
source_relation.description: Indicates the schema which the field originated. This is especially important when leveraging the union schema feature.

model.servicenow.stg_servicenow__cmdb_ci.name: stg_servicenow__cmdb_ci_service
model.servicenow.stg_servicenow__cmdb_ci.description: Staging table containing all records related to CMDB CI service areas.

_fivetran_synced.name: _fivetran_synced
_fivetran_synced.description: Indicates whether the task record has been synchronized by the Fivetran connector.

attributes.name: attributes
attributes.description: Data elements which describe the characteristics of CIs

business_unit_link.name: business_unit_link
business_unit_link.description: Link to business unit. Business units usually comprise departments and are associated with a company

business_unit_value.name: business_unit_value
business_unit_value.description: The ID of the business unit.

company_link.name: company_link
company_link.description: Link to the company associated with the record.

company_value.name: company_value
company_value.description: Value representing the company associated with the record.

cost.name: cost
cost.description: The cost related to the record.

cost_cc.name: cost_cc
cost_cc.description: The cost center that the record belongs to.

managed_by_link.name: managed_by_link
managed_by_link.description: The link to the user profile that manages this record.

managed_by_value.name: managed_by_value
managed_by_value.description: The ID of the user profile that manages this record.

manufacturer_link.name: manufacturer_link
manufacturer_link.description: The link to the manufacturer that manages this record.

manufacturer_value.name: manufacturer_value
manufacturer_value.description: The ID of the manufacturer that manages this record.

model_id_link.name: model_id_link
model_id_link.description: The link to the model related to the CI.

model_id_value.name: model_id_value
model_id_value.description: The ID to the model related to the CI.

model_number.name: model_number
model_number.description: The number of the model related to the IC.

cmdb_ci_service_name.name: cmdb_ci_service_name
cmdb_ci_service_name.description: The full name of the record.

owned_by_link.name: owned_by_link
owned_by_link.description: The link to the owner of the CI related to this record.

owned_by_value.name: owned_by_value
owned_by_value.description: The ID to the owner of the CI related to this record.

service_classification.name: service_classification
service_classification.description: The type of service. Each type contains groups of CI services that share attributes.

service_level_requirement.name: service_level_requirement
service_level_requirement.description: Requirement specified to maintain service commitments between parties.

short_description.name: short_description
short_description.description: Brief or concise summary of the record.

sla_link.name: sla_link
sla_link.description: Link to the Service Level Agreement (SLA) associated with the record.

sla_value.name: sla_value
sla_value.description: Value representing the Service Level Agreement (SLA) associated with the record.

cmdb_ci_service_state.name: cmdb_ci_service_state
cmdb_ci_service_state.description: Current state or status of the record (e.g., in progress, on hold, closed).

subcategory.name: subcategory
subcategory.description: The specific subcategory or classification of the record, providing more detailed information about its nature.

sys_class_name.name: sys_class_name
sys_class_name.description: Name of the table in which the record is stored.

sys_class_path.name: sys_class_path
sys_class_path.description: Where a particular CI class is within the overall hierarchy of classes.

sys_created_by.name: sys_created_by
sys_created_by.description: User who initially created the record.

cmdb_ci_service_created_at.name: cmdb_ci_service_created_at
cmdb_ci_service_created_at.description: Date and time when the record was initially created.

sys_domain_link.name: sys_domain_link
sys_domain_link.description: Link to the system domain associated with the record.

sys_domain_path.name: sys_domain_path
sys_domain_path.description: Path of the system domain associated with the record.

sys_domain_value.name: sys_domain_value
sys_domain_value.description: Value representing the system domain associated with the record.

sys_mod_count.name: sys_mod_count
sys_mod_count.description: Number of times the record has been modified.

sys_updated_by.name: sys_updated_by
sys_updated_by.description: User who last updated or modified the record.

cmdb_ci_service_updated_at.name: cmdb_ci_service_updated_at
cmdb_ci_service_updated_at.description: Date and time when the record was last updated.

vendor_link.name: vendor_link
vendor_link.description: A link to the vendor or external entity associated with the record.

vendor_value.name: vendor_value
vendor_value.description: The name or identifier of the vendor or external entity linked to the record.

source_relation.name: source_relation
source_relation.description: Indicates the schema which the field originated. This is especially important when leveraging the union schema feature.

cost_center_link.name: cost_center_link
cost_center_link.description: Link to the cost center associated with the record.

cost_center_value.name: cost_center_value
cost_center_value.description: Value representing the cost center associated with the record.

monitor.name: monitor
monitor.description: Monitor in relation to the cmdb_ci_service.

model.servicenow.stg_servicenow__problem.name: stg_servicenow__problem_task
model.servicenow.stg_servicenow__problem.description: Staging table containing all the information related to the problem tasks.

source_relation.name: source_relation
source_relation.description: Indicates the schema which the field originated. This is especially important when leveraging the union schema feature.

_fivetran_synced.name: _fivetran_synced
_fivetran_synced.description: Indicates whether the task record has been synchronized by the Fivetran connector.

problem_task_cause_code.name: problem_task_cause_code
problem_task_cause_code.description: The code or identifier associated with the cause of the issue or problem.

problem_task_close_code.name: problem_task_close_code
problem_task_close_code.description: The code or identifier associated with the closure or resolution of the problem task.

other_reason.name: other_reason
other_reason.description: Additional information or reasons associated with the issue, especially if it falls outside standard categories.

problem_link.name: problem_link
problem_link.description: A link to the problem record associated with the issue or incident.

problem_task_type.name: problem_task_type
problem_task_type.description: The type or category of the task associated with the problem or issue.

problem_value.name: problem_value
problem_value.description: The unique identifier or name associated with the problem linked to the record.

reopen_count.name: reopen_count
reopen_count.description: The count of how many times the issue has been reopened.

reopened_at.name: reopened_at
reopened_at.description: The timestamp indicating when the issue was last reopened.

reopened_by_link.name: reopened_by_link
reopened_by_link.description: A link to the person or entity who reopened the issue.

reopened_by_value.name: reopened_by_value
reopened_by_value.description: The name or identifier of the person or entity who reopened the issue.

problem_task_started_at.name: problem_task_started_at
problem_task_started_at.description: The timestamp indicating when the issue or incident was initiated or started.

started_by_link.name: started_by_link
started_by_link.description: A link to the person or entity who initiated or started the issue or incident.

started_by_value.name: started_by_value
started_by_value.description: The name or identifier of the person or entity who initiated or started the issue or incident.

problem_task_created_at.name: problem_task_created_at
problem_task_created_at.description: Date and time when the problem task record was initially created.

problem_task_updated_at.name: problem_task_updated_at
problem_task_updated_at.description: Date and time when the problem task record was last updated.

vendor_link.name: vendor_link
vendor_link.description: A link to the vendor or external entity associated with the record.

vendor_value.name: vendor_value
vendor_value.description: The name or identifier of the vendor or external entity linked to the record.

model.servicenow.stg_servicenow__task_sl.name: stg_servicenow__task_sla
model.servicenow.stg_servicenow__task_sl.description: Staging table containing all Service Level Agreement (SLA) information related to the task.

source_relation.name: source_relation
source_relation.description: Indicates the schema which the field originated. This is especially important when leveraging the union schema feature.

_fivetran_synced.name: _fivetran_synced
_fivetran_synced.description: Indicates whether the task record has been synchronized by the Fivetran connector.

active.name: active
active.description: Flag indicating whether the record is currently active or completed.

business_duration.name: business_duration
business_duration.description: The duration of the task in terms of business time. Represented as an epoch timestamp, or the number of seconds from midnight, January 1, 1970.

business_pause_duration.name: business_pause_duration
business_pause_duration.description: Duration of business pause associated with the task.

business_percentage.name: business_percentage
business_percentage.description: Percentage of business time completed for the task.

business_time_left.name: business_time_left
business_time_left.description: Remaining business time for the completion of the task.

duration.name: duration
duration.description: Total duration of the task, including both business and non-business time.

end_time.name: end_time
end_time.description: The scheduled or expected end time for the task.

has_breached.name: has_breached
has_breached.description: Indicates whether the task has breached the defined SLA or time limits.

original_breach_time.name: original_breach_time
original_breach_time.description: Original time when the SLA breach for the task was detected.

pause_duration.name: pause_duration
pause_duration.description: Duration of the pause associated with the task.

pause_time.name: pause_time
pause_time.description: Time when the task was paused or put on hold.

percentage.name: percentage
percentage.description: Percentage of total time completed for the task.

planned_end_time.name: planned_end_time
planned_end_time.description: The originally planned or expected end time for the task.

schedule_link.name: schedule_link
schedule_link.description: Link to the schedule associated with the task.

schedule_value.name: schedule_value
schedule_value.description: Value representing the schedule associated with the task.

sla_link.name: sla_link
sla_link.description: Link to the Service Level Agreement (SLA) associated with the record.

sla_value.name: sla_value
sla_value.description: Value representing the Service Level Agreement (SLA) associated with the record.

stage.name: stage
stage.description: Current stage or phase of the record's lifecycle.

start_time.name: start_time
start_time.description: The scheduled or expected start time for the record.

sys_created_by.name: sys_created_by
sys_created_by.description: User who initially created the record.

task_sla_created_at.name: task_sla_created_at
task_sla_created_at.description: Date and time when the task sla record was initially created.

sys_mod_count.name: sys_mod_count
sys_mod_count.description: Number of times the record has been modified.

sys_updated_by.name: sys_updated_by
sys_updated_by.description: User who last updated or modified the record.

task_sla_updated_at.name: task_sla_updated_at
task_sla_updated_at.description: Date and time when the task sla record was last updated.

task_link.name: task_link
task_link.description: Link to the related task record.

task_value.name: task_value
task_value.description: Value representing the related task record.

time_left.name: time_left
time_left.description: Remaining time for the completion of the task.

timezone.name: timezone
timezone.description: Timezone information associated with the record.

model.servicenow.stg_servicenow__sys_use.name: stg_servicenow__sys_user_has_role
model.servicenow.stg_servicenow__sys_use.description: Staging table containing information about each unique user and role combination. When a role is added to a user, a new record is created here. This relates the sys_user table with the sys_user_role table.

_fivetran_synced.name: _fivetran_synced
_fivetran_synced.description: Indicates whether the task record has been synchronized by the Fivetran connector.

granted_by_link.name: granted_by_link
granted_by_link.description: The link to the entity that granted this.

granted_by_value.name: granted_by_value
granted_by_value.description: The value of the entity that granted this.

included_in_role_instance_link.name: included_in_role_instance_link
included_in_role_instance_link.description: The link to the role instance included in the role.

included_in_role_instance_value.name: included_in_role_instance_value
included_in_role_instance_value.description: The value of the role instance included in the role.

included_in_role_link.name: included_in_role_link
included_in_role_link.description: The link to the role included in the role.

included_in_role_value.name: included_in_role_value
included_in_role_value.description: The value of the role included in the role.

inherited.name: inherited
inherited.description: Boolean of whether the role is inherited.

role_link.name: role_link
role_link.description: Link to the role in the sys_user_role table.

sys_user_role_id.name: sys_user_role_id
sys_user_role_id.description: The sys_id associated with the role in the sys_user_role table.

sys_user_has_role_state.name: sys_user_has_role_state
sys_user_has_role_state.description: Current state or status of the record (e.g., in progress, on hold, closed).

sys_created_by.name: sys_created_by
sys_created_by.description: User who initially created the record.

sys_user_has_role_created_at.name: sys_user_has_role_created_at
sys_user_has_role_created_at.description: Date and time when the record was initially created.

sys_mod_count.name: sys_mod_count
sys_mod_count.description: Number of times the record has been modified.

sys_updated_by.name: sys_updated_by
sys_updated_by.description: User who last updated or modified the record.

model_id_value.description: The ID to the model related to the CI.

model_number.description: The number of the model related to the IC.

model.servicenow.stg_servicenow__sys_use.raw_code:
with base as (

    select * 
    from {{ ref('stg_servicenow__sys_user_base') }}
),

fields as (

    select
        {{
            fivetran_utils.fill_staging_columns(
                source_columns=adapter.get_columns_in_relation(ref('stg_servicenow__sys_user_base')),
                staging_columns=get_sys_user_columns()
            )
        }}
        {{ fivetran_utils.source_relation(
            union_schema_variable='servicenow_union_schemas', 
            union_database_variable='servicenow_union_databases') 
        }}
    from base
),

final as (
    
    select 
        source_relation,
        cast(sys_id as {{ dbt.type_string() }}) as sys_user_id,
        cast(sys_created_on as {{ dbt.type_timestamp() }}) as user_created_at,
        sys_created_by,
        cast(sys_updated_on as {{ dbt.type_timestamp() }}) as user_updated_at,
        sys_updated_by,
        _fivetran_deleted,
        _fivetran_synced,
        accumulated_roles,
        active as is_active,
        avatar,
        building_link,
        cast(building_value as {{ dbt.type_string() }}) as building_value,
        calendar_integration,
        city,
        company_link,
        cast(company_value as {{ dbt.type_string() }}) as company_value,
        cost_center_link,
        cast(cost_center_value as {{ dbt.type_string() }}) as cost_center_value,
        country,
        date_format,
        default_perspective_link,
        cast(default_perspective_value as {{ dbt.type_string() }}) as default_perspective_value,
        department_link,
        cast(department_value as {{ dbt.type_string() }}) as department_value,
        edu_status,
        email,
        employee_number,
        enable_multifactor_authn,
        failed_attempts,
        first_name,
        gender,
        hashed_user_id,
        home_phone,
        internal_integration_user,
        introduction,
        cast ({{ dbt.date_trunc('day', 'last_login') }} as date)  as last_login_day_date,
        last_login_device,
        last_login_time as last_login_at,
        last_name,
        last_password,
        ldap_server_link,
        cast(ldap_server_value as {{ dbt.type_string() }}) as ldap_server_value,
        location_link,
        cast(location_value as {{ dbt.type_string() }}) as location_value,
        locked_out,
        manager_link,
        cast(manager_value as {{ dbt.type_string() }}) as manager_value,
        middle_name,
        mobile_phone,
        name as sys_user_name,
        notification,
        password_needs_reset,
        phone,
        photo,
        preferred_language,
        roles as sys_user_roles,
        schedule_link,
        cast(schedule_value as {{ dbt.type_string() }}) as schedule_value,
        source,
        state,
        sys_class_name,
        sys_domain_link,
        sys_domain_path,
        cast(sys_domain_value as {{ dbt.type_string() }}) as sys_domain_value,
        sys_mod_count,
        time_format,
        time_zone,
        title,
        user_name,
        user_password,
        vip,
        web_service_access_only,
        zip
    from fields
    where not coalesce(_fivetran_deleted, false)
)

from final
